Title: Data Analyst, People Development
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our team, supporting People Development. The ideal candidate will have an extensive background in data analysis, visualization, and storytelling, with the expertise to drive business insights and inform decision-making.

Data Analyst, People Development Responsibilities:


Design and Develop Data Solutions: Build, maintain, and optimize data flows, reporting tools, and dashboards to generate business insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Communicate Insights Effectively: Utilize data visualization and storytelling techniques to clearly communicate outcomes and insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Influence Data Strategies: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to influence data strategies, roadmap development, and scalable data mart plans.
Provide Direction and Coaching: Offer guidance and coaching to end-users on how to use and interpret metrics, and deliver standard reports/dashboards on a regular cadence.
Collaborate and Partner: Work collaboratively with stakeholders, including research, forecasting analytics, and engineering, to execute best practices in data gathering and analytics.
Maintain Data Integrity: Audit data integrity, investigate concerns, and establish processes to streamline and improve data quality.
Develop Self-Service Reports: Build and automate easy-to-use, self-service reports and dashboards, and maintain code-base (SQL) used to drive self-service tools.


Minimum Qualifications:


7+ years of experience in a strategic analytics development role
Experience managing and analyzing structured and unstructured data using tools such as SQL, Alteryx, and Tableau
Experience navigating a fast-paced, dynamic working environment
Experience communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences across all levels of an organization
Understanding of data visualization principles
Experience handling sensitive data, and exercising judgment and discretion
Experience with survey analysis, data management, and understanding of data structures
Experience with measurement strategies, analytics, change management, design-thinking, program and project management
Experience managing stakeholder requirements and expectations, supporting needs, managing the intake process, and asking questions to scope and solve the requests


Preferred Qualifications:


BA/BS or MA/MS in a field that emphasizes data analysis and visualization (e.g., computer science, social sciences, physical sciences, math, engineering, or statistics), or equivalent work experience
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, including product owners and solution architects, to drive business outcomes through data-driven insights
Experience tackling complex talent development and organizational effectiveness challenges using data analytics
Experience designing and implementing data-driven solutions, conducting research, and applying best practices to drive business impact
Experience applying analytics and research methods to inform talent strategy, workforce planning, and organizational performance


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$150,000/year to $213,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job description:

JOB PURPOSE

 

We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Marketing Data Analyst to join our Marketing Insights team. As a Data Analyst, will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to provide actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making within our marketing department. The successful candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, the ability to translate complex data into meaningful recommendations, and a deep understanding of the luxury fashion industry.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

 

Analyze marketing performance data from various channels, including digital, social media, email, and traditional marketing efforts. 
Interpret key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement. 
Develop and produce comprehensive reports on marketing campaign performance, audience engagement, and ROI.
Design A/B testing strategies to optimize marketing campaigns and improve overall performance.
Provide recommendations for adjustments based on testing outcomes
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to align insights with overall business objectives.
Identify and recommend effective communication and marketing channels to reach target audience segments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing strategy and communication channels.
Collaborate with internal teams, external agencies, and vendors to ensure the successful execution of marketing initiatives.
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate campaign results, insights, and recommendations to key stakeholders.

 

 

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

 

Master's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics or a related field. 

Proven work experience as a Marketing Measurement Specialist or in a similar marketing role.

Strong knowledge of various communication and marketing channels, including digital advertising, social media, email marketing, content marketing, events and traditional media.

Experience in projects like Marketing Attribution models.

Solid understanding of market research methodologies and data analysis techniques.

Familiarity with DMP (Data Management Platform) and CDP (Customer Data Platform) concepts and implementation.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills.

Knowledge of programming languages for data analysis (Python, R, SQL, ecc..)

Strong project management and organizational abilities, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and effectively.

Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.

Creative and innovative mindset, with a passion for staying ahead of marketing trends and technologies.

Fluency in written and spoken English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Asana Marketing team is responsible for fueling business growth and building a brand customers love. We continue to grow, with a global team focused on revenue and field marketing, advertising, brand and content creation, and lifecycle marketing. We’re looking for a talented and driven Data Analyst to help us build foundational infrastructure for marketing to help power our next wave of growth

The Marketing Analytics team is passionate about using data to help make better decisions and serve insights with strategic implications. As a Data Analyst, on the newly formed Marketing Data Foundations sub team you will work on the entire marketing analytics lifecycle, including developing foundational metrics and dashboards, defining measurement methodologies, and leveraging data to drive key strategic decisions. You’ll work in a cross-functional environment with product, sales, data science, biztech and other business analysts to build infrastructure that helps marketers understand and influence Asana’s growth, create KPIs that measure and monitor our progress against business-critical goals, and perform ad hoc analysis diving into the impact of individual campaigns, investments, and initiatives

This role is based in our Warsaw office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays. Working from home on Fridays depends on the type of work you do, and your recruiter can share more about the in-office requirements.

Our employees in Poland are employed under a contract of employment.

What you’ll achieve:


Work collaboratively with other analysts to build and maintain analytics infrastructure.
Design and implement standardized reporting systems for marketing teams.
Develop a deep understanding of marketing and product data to derive actionable insights.
Build and maintain reusable data assets and ETL processes.
Identify gaps in our marketing funnel and surface opportunities.
Design user-friendly dashboards and self-service analytics tools.


About you:

0-1 years of experience Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related technical fieldStrong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilitiesBasic knowledge of SQL


Experience with data manipulation tools (Excel, Google Sheets).
Curious and detail-oriented.
Understanding of marketing metrics and KPIs is a plus.
Familiarity with visualization tools(Tableau, Power BI, or similar) is a plus.
Fluency in English and excellent communication skills.


At Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply.

What we’ll offer:


Generous, transparent and fair compensation system.
Contract of Employment(and the option of 50% tax deductible costs for author’s rights usage in respect of applicable roles).
Health insurance with dental and travel coverage (Lux Med).
Meals reimbursement on the days that you work from the office.
Career growth budget.
Home office setup budget.
Gym/Fitness reimbursement.
Fertility healthcare and family-forming support with Carrot.
Mental Health Support in Modern Health.
Group life insurance.
MacBooks with all necessary accessories.


For this role, the estimated base salary range is between 13 000 - 16 000 PLN gross per month (subject to all taxes and necessary deductions). The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed range above is a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified.

In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity and sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.

About Us

Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's #1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor’s and Inc.’s Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture . With 11+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.

We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join the COO Reporting Team, inside the COO domain.

The responsibility of this team is to establish a fit-for-future and data-driven COO domain through simplified and automated access to data & reporting.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst you will:

Develop and automate reports / dashboards and gather the requirements of the stakeholders to establish the Business Intelligence and analytical needs of each area.
Execute quantitative analyses that translate data into actionable insights; provide analytical and data-driven decision-making support for key projects.
Manage and respond to internal and external, requests and queries including a variety of reporting requirements.
Performance reporting: Prepare updates on business and performance metrics (OKRs / KPIs).

What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




The candidate:




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Engineering / Mathematics or related technical discipline.
Work experience of at least 2 years in a related field.
Experience with analytical tools supporting data evaluation and reporting, as well as querying large complex data sets (PL/SQL, SAS, etc.).
Experience in the use of Python.
Experience in the use BI tooling, such as PowerBI or MicroStrategy.
Demonstrated use of analytics, metrics, and benchmarking to drive decisions.
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English).
Able to work in an autonomous way, to take initiative and to make things happen with a can-do attitude.
Problem solving mindset.
Flexible, dynamic, capable of working in multidisciplinary environments in coordination with the rest of the areas.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues’ needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RIÑG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst Junior
Description:
A STARFACE é detentora de um conjunto de empresas vocacionadas para os serviços de limpeza profissional.

As marcas que integram o Grupo são CARFACE; AIRFACE, LOGIFACE, STARWASH.




Oferecemos serviços de limpeza especializada e logística em diversos setores de atividade, nomeadamente Rent-a-Car, Concessionários, Importadores, Centros de Lavagem em Centros Comerciais e Parques Públicos, Barcos, Private Jets, Aviação Comercial, Limpeza de Casas, Escritórios, Espaços Públicos, entre outros desafios que nos apresentam.




A nossa experiência de cerca de 30 anos abrange diversos setores de atividade, tendo sempre como objetivo entregar um serviço de qualidade, a satisfação e a próximidade do cliente,




DESCRIÇÃO DA FUNÇÃO

A função está alinhada com a reestruturação da empresa na digitalização de processos e no desenvolvimento de reports de apoio às áreas de negócio.

A função tem como missão melhorar o fluxo de gestão financeira, desde a fase de orçamentação, report P&L, identificação de desvios e apresentação de resultados.

A função integrará a equipa de Direção Financeira

A função está elegível e é preferencial para um Estágio Profissional IEFP




ATIVIDADES A DESEMPENHAR

Acompanhamento das atividades diárias da área financeira;
Elaboração de reports de gestão operacional e financeiros e identificação de desvios
Implementação e continuidade de um modelo de report dinâmico (Power BI)
Construção e acompanhamento de orçamentos das áreas de negócio
Participação em projetos e desafios de mudança organizacional e processual que contribuirão para o desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional.




QUALIFICAÇÕES

Formação superior na área de Gestão, Economia ou Finanças;
Bons conhecimentos MS Office, nomeadamente domínio de Excel;
Elevada capacidade analítica e de interpretação de resultados;
Capacidade de organização e trabalho em equipa
Facilidade de relacionamento interpessoal, dinamismo, proatividade, trabalho em equipa;




Show more

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
HTML:
Lindt & Sprüngli, entreprise internationale du secteur agro-alimentaire est reconnue comme l'un des principaux leaders sur le marché du chocolat au travers de marques emblématiques telles que Lindor, Excellence, Champs-Elysées et Pyrénéens.


Venez enchanter le monde en rejoignant notre équipe commerciale à Paris Trocadéro.


Le/la Data Analyst participe à la transformation data-driven de la DNV (Direction Nationale des Ventes) en assurant la disponibilité, la qualité et la pertinence des données GMS (Grandes & Moyennes Surfaces). Il/elle structure les données, délivre les tableaux de bord sous les formats les plus pertinents et recommande les meilleures solutions data au service de la performance de la Direction Commerciale.


Missions :

Analyse et exploitation des données GMS :

  • Collecter les besoins métiers, croiser les sources, produire des analyses claires et activables pour les équipes de la DNV (siège et terrain) ;
  • Fournir des analyses ponctuelles ou récurrentes à la DNV et à la Direction Commerciale ;
  • Garantir la fiabilité et la qualité des données (algorithmes de scoring, suivi des anomalies…) avec le support des chargés d’animation des ventes.


Production et amélioration continue des outils d’analyse de données GMS :

  • Identifier et mettre à disposition des produits data à forte valeur ajoutée : dashboards, reportings, jeux de données, outils d’aide à la décision… ;
  • Créer, maintenir et déployer des dashboards de suivi de performance GMS (KPIs Force de Vente) avec le support de la DSI (Direction des Systèmes d’Information) ;
  • Être force de proposition sur l’évolution des outils de suivi de la performance GMS et sur les meilleures solutions d’analyse de données.


Communication et acculturation « Data » :

  • Être lead sur des sujets transverses avec la DCN/DCM pour moderniser les outils internes et les projets d’interface avec le CRM ;
  • Favoriser l’appropriation des outils analytiques au sein des équipes, former à leur utilisation et impulser une dynamique globale autour des usages des données ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes data, IT et métiers pour délivrer les projets ;
  • Être en veille sur nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse de données.


Parcours :

  • Formation bac+4/5 (école de commerce, d’ingénieur ou équivalent) avec une spécialisation en analyse de données ;
  • Expérience de 3 à 4 ans sur des missions similaires ;
  • Solide compréhension des indicateurs de performance commerciale ; une bonne connaissance des enjeux GMS sera fortement appréciée (ou, à défaut, une ouverture d’esprit sur l’univers Sales).


Compétences techniques :

  • Expertise en visualisation et interprétation de données ;
  • Capacité à modéliser des données complexes dans un environnement multi-sources ;
  • Maîtrise des concepts de qualité et de fiabilité des données ;
  • Maîtrise des outils BI (notamment Power BI), manipulation de bases de données ;
  • Aisance avec les outils d’IA générative (ex. : Copilot, ChatGPT) et de productivité moderne.


Savoir-être et relationnel :

  • Excellentes capacités de communication, vulgarisation et pédagogie ;
  • Leadership transversal, capacité à embarquer des profils techniques et métiers ;
  • Rigueur, sens de l’analyse et goût pour la donnée ;
  • Esprit d’équipe, écoute active et orientation utilisateur ;
  • Adaptabilité, autonomie, curiosité, sens de l’initiative.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Company: Financiera El Corte Inglés E.F.C, S.A.
Description:
📊 Convierte los datos en decisiones estratégicas en Financiera El Corte Inglés




En Financiera El Corte Inglés, potenciamos la innovación y la eficiencia en cada área de negocio. Si te apasiona traducir datos en insights que impulsen resultados, queremos contar contigo. Buscamos un perfil analítico para apoyar la estrategia comercial a través del análisis de datos, campañas e incentivos.




🎯 Tu misión




Serás el nexo entre los datos y las decisiones. Diseñarás herramientas visuales, analizarás el rendimiento comercial e impulsarás mejoras estratégicas alineadas con los objetivos del negocio.




🛠️ Funciones principales




Diseñar, implementar y mantener cuadros de mando comerciales.
Analizar el comportamiento y resultados de la fuerza de ventas.
Optimizar sistemas de incentivos alineados con la estrategia.
Evaluar campañas comerciales y proponer mejoras.
Coordinarte con equipos multifuncionales para garantizar calidad y disponibilidad de los datos.
Elaborar informes de seguimiento con KPIs.
Organizar y explotar bases de datos comerciales.




🔍 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

-Grado/Licenciatura en ADE, Económicas, Ingeniería, Estadística o similar.

-2-3 años de experiencia en análisis comercial, idealmente en financiero o retail.

-Conocimiento en productos financieros, procesos comerciales y herramientas como Power BI, Excel avanzado, VBA y bases de datos.

-Inglés nivel medio.




🎁 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

-Proyectos retadores e impacto directo en la estrategia.

-Retribución flexible: tarjeta restaurante, transporte y guardería.

-Flexibilidad horaria y 30% de teletrabajo.

-Formación continua y clases de inglés.

-Descuentos exclusivos para empleados.




📈 Si buscas llevar el análisis comercial al siguiente nivel, este es tu momento.

Únete a nuestro equipo y transforma datos en decisiones con Financiera El Corte Inglés.




#Empleo #AnálisisComercial #DataDriven #PowerBI #RetailFinance #OportunidadProfesional

Show more

-Grado/Licenciatura en ADE, Económicas, Ingeniería, Estadística o similar.

-2-3 años de experiencia en análisis comercial, idealmente en financiero o retail.

-Conocimiento en productos financieros, procesos comerciales y herramientas como Power BI, Excel avanzado, VBA y bases de datos.

-Inglés nivel medio.


🎁 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

-Proyectos retadores e impacto directo en la estrategia.

-Retribución flexible: tarjeta restaurante, transporte y guardería.

-Flexibilidad horaria y 30% de teletrabajo.

-Formación continua y clases de inglés.

-Descuentos exclusivos para empleados.


📈 Si buscas llevar el análisis comercial al siguiente nivel, este es tu momento.

Únete a nuestro equipo y transforma datos en decisiones con Financiera El Corte Inglés.


#Empleo #AnálisisComercial #DataDriven #PowerBI #RetailFinance #OportunidadProfesional

Title: Junior - Data Analyst
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilità

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team è un team all’avanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l’opportunità di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacità di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell’informativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle società identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.

Starting date: Settembre 2025

Tipologia di inserimento: Apprendistato

Nello specifico ti occuperai di:


Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull’utilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:


Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l’area del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all’interno di un Network Internazionale


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Responsibilities

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG’s innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors – through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training – developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies’ IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.

Starting date: September 2025

Type of contract : Apprenticeship

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network


Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.


Together for Better – Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

Thanks to our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which attests to the compliance of our Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125 certification, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find a summary of all the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy .

KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Internship Details


Duration: 6 months + 6 months
Location: Madrid, attendance to the office required 3 days a week
Schedule: Monday to Friday, from 10am to 19pm
Start date 7th July


The Studio Operations team is a global team across 30+ locations and includes Quality Verification and Standards, Central Development Operations, Localization, Animation, Audio, Capture, Rigging and Blendshapes. As a central team, we bring together the best development solutions to further support game teams in achieving their vision and EA's ambition to be the best place to make games.

Within Studio Operations, we are members of the Player & Quality Insights team that focuses on understanding player behavior and designing player feedback events which help game teams develop high-quality games to meet our player's expectations. We are a data-driven team where every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts.

Working alongside our Data Analysts team, you will oversee and conduct the conversion of data into insights to lead to informed decisions. You will help with the development, implementation, testing and maintenance of our data systems infrastructure, including semantic models, dashboards and reports to help teams analyse and investigate their results.

Key Duties And Responsibilities


Conduct data analyses using statistical software, databases and BI tools
Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate and clean data from different sources
Create, operate and maintain script-driven methodologies for the generation of analysis and reports.
Perform quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency
Interacting with internal clients
Dealing with data providers in client organizations, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received, and follow up with data providers on data issues.
Dealing directly with clients on projects involving technical methodologies
Presenting results to clients in a clear and respectful manner, and maintaining professionalism in collecting feedback
Project management and quality assurance of active projects
Dashboard and Visualization Development
Develop visually appealing and intuitive dashboards
Leverage advanced visualization techniques to effectively communicate insights
Ensure adherence to best practices in data visualization, story building and user experience design

Required


Student of Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or similar studies.
Advanced level of English, both written and verbal, strong communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Knowledge of SQL, R Statistical software and/or Python
Knowledge of Business Intelligence principles and concepts
Interest in gaming is a big plus.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Country: Portugal

Descrição Geral da Função

Apoiar a tomada de decisões estratégicas e operacionais relacionadas com Acompanhamento de Crédito, através da análise de dados, criação de dashboards e colaboração com diferentes stakeholders de negócio.

Principais Responsabilidades

  • Usar ferramentas de exploração, tratamento e extração de dados de diferentes fontes (ex.: SAS e SQL Developer);
  • Desenhar e criar dashboards para melhorar a visualização de dados e KPI’s que dêem suporte as decisões e estratégias de negócio a implementar;
  • Analisar e interpretar dados para construir estatísticas que permitam ao negócio tomar decisões ponderadas e sustentadas;
  • Colaborar com as áreas de negócio para a partilha de informação e discussão que envolvam dados e as suas fontes de informação;
  • Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação de negócio relacionadas com as carteiras de crédito e a recuperação de crédito para diferentes segmentos de clientes.

Requisitos

  • Percurso académico em Matemática, Estatística, Econometria, Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou similar;
  • Experiência relevante no negócio bancário;
  • Sólidos conhecimentos de exploração e análise de dados (SAS Guide, SQL, Python, R ou semelhante);
  • Bons conhecimentos de MS-Office, nomeadamente Excel e PowerPoint;
  • Bons conhcimentos de Inglês e valorizamos conhecimentos de Espanhol;
  • Perfil técnico com forte capacidade de otimização processos de extração de informação adaptadas aos requisitos de negócio;
  • Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas;
  • Autonomia, rigor, proatividade e orientação para resultados;
  • Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders;
  • Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo.

Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark. 

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.







Responsibilities:
Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
 Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency





Key Competencies:
University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits. 
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape. 
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members
Able to speak and communicate in English


Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications












Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A TUA MISSÃO

Estamos à procura de um(a) Data Analyst para se juntar à Direção de Recursos Humanos do Pingo Doce. O teu principal desafio será traduzir dados em insights estratégicos, apoiando uma gestão mais eficaz de pessoas e operações numa das maiores empresas do retalho em Portugal.


O QUE VAIS FAZER

• Analisar e consolidar dados de RH (assiduidade, formação, recrutamento, desempenho, etc.);

• Elaborar dashboards e relatórios regulares com Power BI, Excel, SQL, Python ou R;

• Monitorizar KPIs de RH, identificando tendências e melhorias;

• Fornecer informação relevante às equipas internas e operacionais;

• Otimizar processos de reporting e gestão da informação e garantir a confidencialidade dos dados;


O TEU PERFIL

• Licenciatura em RH, Gestão, Estatística, Engenharia, Sistemas de Informação ou similar;

• Mínimo 2 anos de experiência em análise de dados, idealmente em grandes organizações;

• Capacidade analítica, atenção ao detalhe e pensamento crítico;

• Excel e Power BI obrigatórios; valorizam-se conhecimentos de SQL, Python ou R;

• Boa comunicação e adaptação a diferentes públicos, colaborativo, autónomo e responsável;

• Proatividade em ambientes dinâmicos com foco em resultados.


QUEM SOMOS E O QUE PODES ESPERAR DE NÓS

Porque é que trabalhar connosco é diferente? Porque aqui, as pessoas estão no centro de tudo o que fazemos. Ao integrares a nossa equipa terás acesso a:

  • 22 dias de férias + 2 dias*
  • Políticas de compensação competitivas
  • Oportunidades de formação e desenvolvimento
  • Ginásio, cabeleireiro e estética, cantina, clínica médica, nutrição e outras iniciativas de bem estar
  • Iniciativas de apoio familiar, saúde e educação e acesso a protocolos

* mediante cumprimento de critérios de absentismo.


Sabe mais acerca de como é trabalhar no Grupo Jerónimo Martins através do nosso website ou página de LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst - F/H
Description:
CDI Data Analyst F/H à pourvoir dès que possible




Vous avez la capacité à transformer un océan de chiffres en informations stratégiques précieuses pour l’entreprise ? À l’aise avec les statistiques et les bases de données, vous décelez les tendances et les comportements clients ? Vous aimez analyser et visualiser des données complexes ? Ce métier vous place au cœur des décisions stratégiques avec une analyse précise des données récoltées.

Parce que chaque donnée compte pour optimiser sa stratégie, Arte France Développement, filiale d’Arte France, recrute un data analyst pour soutenir la croissance de l’activité Vidéo à la Demande (VOD) liée à la plateforme Arte Boutique et à la distribution des contenus de son catalogue auprès des plateformes partenaires.




Vous aurez comme mission :




Analyse Data :

Analyser des ensembles de données pour identifier les tendances et les modèles pertinents pour nourrir notre dynamique de croissance
Effectuer des analyses statistiques pour valider des résultats
Proposer des recommandations basées sur les résultats d’analyse
Elaborer des rapports et des tableaux de bord pour communiquer les résultats aux équipes
Assurer la qualité des données en réalisant des vérifications régulières

Veille technologique et suivi de l’activité :

Faire de la veille technologique des nouveaux outils visant à l’améliorer l’analyse des données
Mettre en œuvre et exploiter des technologies pour automatiser la collecte et l’analyse de données
Concevoir et exécuter des expériences pour tester des hypothèses

Coordination :

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes marketing, commercial et éditorial pour identifier leurs besoins et répondre à leurs questions stratégiques




Profil recherché




Parce que le rôle de Data Analyst est clé dans notre développement, nous recherchons les compétences suivantes :

compréhension approfondie des concepts statistiques et des méthodes d’analyse
capacité à communiquer efficacement des résultats à des non-spécialistes
compétences en visualisation des données
maîtrise des outils d’analyse de données, tels que SQL, R ou Python
aptitude à résoudre des problèmes complexes en utilisant des données
attention aux détails pour garantir l’exactitude des analyses
compétences en gestion de projet pour gérer des échéances et des priorités
capacité à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe




Parce qu’on aime bien les petits plus :

Le cinéma, les documentaires et les séries, ça vous parle ? Parce que vous allez baigner dedans. Autant vous préparer à disserter sur le dernier Ozon ou à imaginer « En thérapie » Saison 3 entre deux régressions statistiques
Do you speak english ? On aime bien aussi la langue de Shakespeare ou de Christopher Nolan, surtout qu’elle peut être très utile pour le poste
Comme on est déjà équipé, la connaissance d’Amplitude vous donnera un petit avantage, mais une customer data platform reste une customer data platform
Questions cursus : master en marketing, master en big data, master en mathématiques ou spécialisation en statistiques nous paraissent un bon début. Si vous avez en plus 3 ans d’expérience minimum dans un poste similaire




Si vous vous reconnaissez dans cette description ? On a très envie de vous rencontrer.




Le groupe ARTE est convaincu que la pluralité des talents et des parcours est une force et s’engage en faveur de la diversité et de l’inclusion.

Title: Data Analyst (Rif. 2025-136)
Description:
aizoOn, società di consulenza tecnologica di innovazione, indipendente, che opera a livello globale ricerca un / a Data Analyst.




Il / La candidato / a verrà inserito / a nella Divisione di Mercato Transportation di aizoOn ed opererà per un nostro importante cliente multinazionale Automotive nel ruolo di Data Analyst.




Nell’ambito di dati provenienti da finance, gestione contratti e telemetria veicolare, si occuperà dell’analisi di questi ultimi e della generazione di reportistica, interagendo con le varie aree IT e con il Business.




PROFILO




Laurea in discipline tecnico-scientifiche
2-3 anni di esperienza in ambito data analysis e software development
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata (minimo B2)
Precisione e capacità analitiche
Ottime capacità comunicative







COMPETENZE TECNICHE




Esperienza consolidata nell’utilizzo di SQL
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di Python
Ottima padronanza nell'utilizzo di Excel
Conoscenza di servizi REST API
Conoscenza di cloud services, principalmente AWS




Da considerarsi un plus la conoscenza di DB no SQL e Power BI







The job search refers to candidates of both genders

Title: Data Analyst - Junior/Senior Level
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎 We are looking for a Data Analyst - Junior and Senior Level




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze large volumes of data to help with business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports in Power BI to show results clearly.
Process, clean and transform data with Python, PySpark or Scala, especially in Big Data environments.
Building data pipelines (ETL) and preparing datasets for analysis.
Collaboration with technical and business teams to ensure data quality and consistency.
Supporting continuous improvement and data governance initiatives.
Automate processes to save time and avoid errors.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Experience in Power BI (modeling, DAX, visualizations).
Python skills applied to data analysis.
Knowledge of PySpark / Spark / Scala (valued in Big Data environments).
Solid knowledge of SQL.
Notions of data quality and governance.
Good communication skills (technical and non-technical).
Analytical mind and problem-solving orientation.
Proactivity and a sense of responsibility.
Proficiency in English (minimum B2).




📍Hybrid Role in Porto.




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’Open Banking è il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 è una realtà indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo è diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farà parte dell’area Data Management di Centrico in qualità di Data Analyst e si occuperà di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilità:

Analizzerai grandi quantità di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l’individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l’implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacità relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacità analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attività di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalità ibrida.

Show more

Title: Estágio Profissional - Data Analytics
HTML:
A ANA faz parte do Grupo VINCI, que é o operador privado líder mundial no seu sector, gerindo uma rede de mais de 70 aeroportos em 13 países da Europa, Ásia, África e Américas.


A Área Administrativa e Financeira da Direção do Aeroporto Humberto Delgado pretende recrutar um(a) estagiário(a) para um estágio profissional de Data Analytics.


Principais atividades a desenvolver:

  • Analisar grandes volumes de dados para identificação e monitorização de KPI financeiros;
  • Apoiar no desenvolvimento de modelos financeiros de apoio à área administrativa e de faturação;
  • Apoiar no desenvolvimento de sistemas de cálculo de custos;
  • Contribuir para a automatização de tarefas rotineiras:
  • Conceber e implementar ferramentas e metodologias de análise de dados para a melhoria da qualidade e precisão dos dados.


Requisitos:

  • Licenciatura em Gestão, Economia, Informática de Gestão, Informática, Matemática Aplicada à Gestão, Engenharia Industrial ou qualificação similar;
  • Experiência na utilização de MS Office e proficiência em Excel;
  • Experiência em ferramentas de visualização de dados Power BI, SQL, SAP/BO e Python é uma vantagem;
  • Fluência em Inglês (falado e escrito);
  • Boa capacidade de interpretação dos dados, responsabilidade, proatividade e gosto pelo trabalho em equipa.


Perfil:

  • Elevado grau de auto-iniciativa, auto-independência e capacidade analítica;
  • Boa capacidade de organização e planeamento;
  • Capacidade de trabalho em equipa e bom relacionamento interpessoal (necessário para interagir com as diversas áreas da empresa);
  • Flexibilidade e agilidade para entregar resultados em curto espaço de tempo.


Outras informações:

Local do estágio: Lisboa

Duração do estágio: 12 meses

Início do estágio: a acordar com o(a) Candidato(a) selecionado(a)


Diversidade e inclusão:

A nossa cultura está baseada na diversidade das origens e das experiências. A ANA opõe-se a quaisquer formas de discriminação na contratação, nas relações laborais e no desenvolvimento profissional dos seus colaboradores. Comprometendo-se a promover a igualdade de oportunidades, independentemente do género, idade, religião ou crença, orientação sexual, ideologia política, raça ou etnia.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




• Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

• Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

• Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

• Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

• Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

• Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

• Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

• Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

• Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

• Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

• Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

• Possibility of Working from Home – we care about results not locations;

• Training Budget for each employee – we care about the growth of our people;

• Private Health Insurance – we care about health on and off working hours;

• 3 Additional Vacation Days – we care about free time;

• Cooking, sports or book club – we care about spending time with our folks;

• Fresh fruits – we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

• Fresh coffee, tea or water – we care about boosting your day.

• A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Show more

• A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;


An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst seeking a new interesting challenge? 🔍

If your answer is yes, it’s your lucky day so keep reading, it can be just what you're looking for! 👀




🧐 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR IN YOU?

Experience in Data Domain, Data Dictionary, Data Governance.
Expertise (E2 at least) in SQL and preparing medium to high complexity queries. Good to have - exposure to RDBMS, NoSQL, cloud Databases - Redshift/Snowflake as well as flat files - as per real world scenarios.
Data sampling, Data quality analysis, Data Modelling.
Responsible for Data mapping deliverables (Source-to-target mappings) as well as Data dictionary providing a detailed understanding of new product builds.
Adept in analytical abilities to determine root cause for data issues with quick turnaround.
Awareness/Understanding of GDPR and Data encryption best practices and norms followed as per global IT standards.
Familiarity with Aviation domain - is an added advantage. Alternatively quick learner to adapt to Airlines Operations domain terms and terminologies - considering the client landscape.
Provide playback of role specific deliverables to Build teams to provide in depth end to end Data flow understanding for product.
Should have a good balance of business, data and moderate technical understanding - to enable effective stakeholder management.




📅 WHERE AND WHEN?

Workplace: Lisbon + hybrid work
Work Schedule: 9AM to 6PM




🤝 WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU?

Permanent contract 📋
Pay and benefits 💸 - Competitive salary and a flexible compensation plan adapted to your needs (Ticket restaurant plan + Health Insurance).
Opportunity knocks 👍🏻 - Being a part of a growing company, we want to support your path with a career development plan and annual performance-based compensation reviews.
Learn as you grow 📚 - Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, TCS has robust learning platforms that will allow you to learn and grow personal as professionally.
Bring your buddy 👫 - If you have referred a friend for an open position under the BYB Scheme and she/he is hired you’ll receive a very attractive cash award.
Connect globally 🌏 - Work with people from all over the world. You can feel the multicultural workforce.
And so on 🎉 - Appreciations, incentives, Team Building activities, diversity and inclusion programs, sustainability activities, corporative events... This has only just begun!




💡 WHO ARE WE?

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an Information Technology (IT) company founded in 1968, being part of the Tata Group.

With a presence in 55 countries and over 600,000 employees, TCS is recognized as the #1 Employer in Europe by the Top Employers Institute 🥇

In our portfolio of services, we have information technology services, asset-based solutions, global consulting, engineering and industrial services, digital solutions and services, application maintenance and development, quality assurance and testing services, IT infrastructure and BPS 🎯

We stand out for our experience, reliability, passion, confidence, creativity and skills 💯




WELCOME, WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU! 🚀

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Fenergo, our aim is to future-proof Client Lifecyle Management through our award-winning SaaS based solutions that empower financial institutions. With the expertise of our 700 employees across 11 offices worldwide we enable our clients to improve operational efficiencies and return on investment, manage compliance with KYC, AML and reduce risk with continuous monitoring of clients and transactions throughout the client lifecycle.

Fenergo dynamically manages any client type, any product type and every client journey for all segments, channels and devices.

As a company we value collaboration with cross functional teams, driving employee engagement and are champions of diversity and inclusion. As we continue to grow and evolve, we look for team members who will make a meaningful impact, contribute to a positive work environment and shape the future of our organisation.

Join us as we build a workplace where talent thrives and together, we achieve new heights of success!

Requirements

What Will You Do?

You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining key dataset and models across the organisation which are driven from our cloud-based data lake infrastructure on AWS. You will work closely with a ringfenced team of system engineers, data analysts and a delivery manager to implement best practices for data management and contribute to the overall success of our data platform. This role is ideal for an enthusiastic individual with a strong analytical background who is passionate about working on innovative data projects.

Responsibilities:


Collect, process and analyse data to derive insights and inform business decisions
Develop and maintain datasets and data models
Create visualizations and reports to present findings to stakeholders
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data
Collaborate with teams to define data requirements and goals
Ensure data quality and integrity
Stay current on industry best practices and data analysis techniques
Utilize statistical and analytical tools to interpret data
Monitor and maintain data quality through regular audits and assessments
Collaborate with data governance teams to establish data quality policies
Create and maintain data quality documentation
Train and educate employees on data quality best practices
Perform data profiling and analysis to identify potential data quality problems
Utilize data quality tools and technologies to improve data accuracy and consistency



Expectations


3+ years in a Data Analytics role
You have good experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
You have strong critical thinking skills and ability to analyse complex datasets
You are proficient in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python or R, middleware solutions such as Workato and have some experience with Snowflake, DBT or Redshift
You are a storyteller, who can communicate your insights to your team and cross functionally
You are great at prioritising, you know when to say yes and equally importantly, you know when to say no and you do that the right way
You are curious, asking great questions, looking to always improve how we work and how you can grow professionally and personally



Our Promise To You

We are striving to become global leaders across all of the categories we operate in and as part of that we are a high-performing highly collaborative team that works cross functionally to accommodate our clients needs.

What we value is at the CORE of how we succeed:


Collaboration: Working together to achieve our best
Outcomes: Drive Success in every engagement
Respect: A collective feeling of inclusion and belonging
Excellence: Continuously raising the bar



Benefits


Healthcare cover through the VHI
Company pension contribution
Life assurance/ Income protection
23 days annual leave
3 company days
Annual bonus opportunity
Work From Home set-up allowance
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale for a world leader in Client Lifecycle Management
Other competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programs, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University'
Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress.
Active sports and social club
State of the art offices in the heart of Dublin's Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area



Diversity, Equality, and Inclusivity

Fenergo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where all employees are valued, respected, and can reach their full potential. We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Our hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We believe that a diverse workforce enriches our company culture, fosters innovation, and contributes to our overall success. We strive to provide a fair and supportive environment for all employees, promoting equal opportunities for career development and advancement. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply for employment opportunities and join our team in contributing to a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
