Title: Data Analyst (Seller Experience Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Data Analyst (Marketplace, Seller Experience Team)

The Data Analyst – Seller Experience will play a central role in driving data-informed decisions across the entire Seller Experience division at eMAG. This role goes beyond a traditional reporting function; it is a strategic partner embedded directly in the product and experience organization. The analyst will support multiple verticals including seller onboarding, acquisition channels, performance monitoring, funnel optimization, UI/UX governance, and A/B testing initiatives.

Working closely with product managers, UX, content, comms, and seller support teams, the analyst will be responsible for creating and maintaining dashboards, conducting deep-dive analyses, and helping define KPIs that drive product prioritization and continuous improvement. This includes support across both web and mobile surfaces, as well as strategic initiatives like rating systems, personalization frameworks, and educational tools for sellers.

The role requires a balance of strong technical skills (SQL, data visualization, experimentation methods) and a good understanding of product dynamics. The analyst is expected to translate large volumes of raw data into insights that are easy to understand, actionable, and aligned with the annual OKRs of the division, reviewed monthly.

What you’ll have to do:


Partner with Product Managers, UX Designers, and other stakeholders to define, monitor, and evolve product KPIs across all seller-facing surfaces (e.g., dashboard, mobile app, onboarding flows, CRM).
Design and maintain self-service dashboards that support day-to-day decision-making across the Seller Experience division.
Analyze behavioral data to uncover insights on seller engagement, feature adoption, friction points, and drop-off across funnels.
Build tracking plans and collaborate with developers to ensure consistent and reliable event instrumentation across platforms.
Own the end-to-end analysis lifecycle for major initiatives: define the hypothesis, pull and validate the data, analyze trends, and present actionable recommendations.
Conduct A/B test analysis to validate the impact of new features or experience changes, ensuring statistical rigor and clear communication of results.
Identify data quality issues, propose solutions, and work with engineering or data teams to address inconsistencies or gaps.
Provide ongoing support to quarterly OKRs and monthly performance reviews by delivering insights that shape prioritization and roadmap adjustments.
Contribute to the creation of a shared understanding of seller behavior across teams by building consistent reporting layers and documentation.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve how data is captured, structured, visualized, and used in decision-making across the division.


Reporting Structure


Reports directly to the Product Director, Seller Experience.
Collaborates closely with multiple Product Managers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, UX Designers, and Content/Communication teams.
Acts as the primary analytical partner for initiatives across acquisition channels, onboarding, dashboard usage, UI/UX governance, funnel performance, and experimentation.
Works in alignment with the centralized Data & AI team for access to infrastructure, best practices, and integration with platform-wide data models.
Participates in monthly OKR check-ins and product performance reviews alongside division leadership.


Success Metrics

The success of the Data Analyst – Seller Experience will be evaluated through a combination of impact-driven results, execution quality, and alignment with the division’s annual OKRs. Key performance indicators include:

Impact Metrics


Coverage of KPIs: Defined and tracked KPIs for all key product areas (e.g., onboarding, dashboard usage, mobile, login, CRM, etc.).
Funnel Clarity: Improved visibility into seller behavior across acquisition and engagement funnels, leading to actionable product decisions.
OKR Support: Quality and relevance of data used to support quarterly prioritization and monthly performance reviews.
A/B Test Insights: Volume and quality of validated experiments (e.g., share of releases backed by statistically significant test results).


Execution Quality Metrics


Dashboard Adoption: Number of self-service dashboards built and actively used by product, UX, and support teams.
Speed to Insight: Time from data request to first actionable insight, especially around high-impact product changes.
Data Accuracy: Reduction in reporting inconsistencies or data-related blockers in decision-making.
Collaboration Score: Internal feedback from PMs and stakeholders regarding clarity, responsiveness, and value of delivered insights.


What makes you a good fit:

Experience And Background


3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Product Analyst role, preferably in a digital product or eCommerce environment.
Proven ability to work with product and cross-functional teams to generate actionable insights that drive measurable outcomes.
Experience supporting product discovery, feature rollout, and UX iteration cycles through structured analysis.


Technical Skills


Strong proficiency in SQL (e.g., BigQuery, PostgreSQL, or similar) for data extraction, transformation, and performance analysis.
Experience building and maintaining dashboards in BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with product analytics tools like Amplitude, Mixpanel, or Google Analytics for behavior tracking and funnel analysis.
Ability to design and interpret A/B tests; understanding of statistical significance, test design, and experimentation platforms.
Experience working with large datasets, joining across multiple sources (e.g., CRM, product logs, feedback platforms).
Comfortable working with data in Google Sheets, Excel, or Python (optional but a plus).


Analytical Thinking and Business Context


Ability to transform vague questions into structured analysis plans, and raw data into clear business narratives.
Solid understanding of metrics frameworks: DAU, MAU, conversion rates, retention curves, NPS, engagement ratios, etc.
Experience defining KPIs and building metric hierarchies for product dashboards, funnels, or seller engagement.
High attention to detail when validating data quality or interpreting trends.
Understanding of marketplace dynamics and multi-stakeholder ecosystems is a strong plus.


Communication and Collaboration


Able to communicate complex data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience working alongside Product Managers, UX Designers, and Content/Support teams to iterate on solutions.
Strong documentation skills: analysis notes, dashboards, tracking plans, etc.
Proactive and self-driven: able to push analysis forward even when requirements are not fully defined.


What makes you stand out:


Familiarity with experimentation platforms (e.g., Optimizely, Google Optimize, or in-house testing tools).
Prior experience supporting B2B platforms or seller/vendor interfaces.
Understanding of UI/UX data modeling or behavioral analytics.
Exposure to Python or dbt for data modeling is a plus.


Growth Opportunities

This role offers the opportunity to grow as a strategic analytical partner across one of eMAG’s most dynamic product areas. As the Seller Experience division continues to evolve, the Data Analyst will be well-positioned to deepen their impact and accelerate their career growth through:


Domain Ownership: Ability to progressively own specific verticals (e.g., onboarding, mobile seller app, performance tools) and become the go-to expert for data-driven decisions in that space.
Strategic Influence: Increased participation in quarterly planning, OKR setting, and roadmap validation by shaping how data is used to assess opportunity, risk, and performance.
Methodological Depth: Development in areas such as experimentation design, segmentation models, retention analysis, or funnel diagnostics—based on business needs and personal interest.
Cross-Divisional Exposure: Opportunities to support or collaborate with teams outside Seller Experience, such as Platform, Fulfillment, or Buyer Experience, depending on project scope.
Path to Seniority: Clear growth path toward a Senior Data Analyst role or hybrid Product-Data role, depending on profile and performance.
Professional Development: Access to training resources, cross-team learning, and potential mentorship by senior analysts in the centralized Data & AI function.


This role is ideal for a data-driven professional who thrives in fast-paced, product-focused environments and wants to make a real impact on how sellers interact with one of the largest eCommerce platforms in the region. The Data Analyst – Seller Experience will work at the intersection of user behavior, product strategy, and performance optimization, turning complex data into simple, actionable insights.

We value structured thinking, proactive collaboration, and a strong sense of ownership. You’ll be part of a team where your input will directly shape what gets built, how it's measured, and how success is defined across multiple product surfaces. You’ll work closely with a diverse mix of product managers, designers, and content teams, and be supported by modern tools and a growing analytics culture.

If you're looking for a role where you can influence both the what and the why of product decisions—while continuously sharpening your analytical and business skills—this is the place to grow.

What we’ve prepared for you:


Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Growth Opportunities

This role offers the opportunity to grow as a strategic analytical partner across one of eMAG’s most dynamic product areas. As the Seller Experience division continues to evolve, the Data Analyst will be well-positioned to deepen their impact and accelerate their career growth through:

  • Domain Ownership: Ability to progressively own specific verticals (e.g., onboarding, mobile seller app, performance tools) and become the go-to expert for data-driven decisions in that space.
  • Strategic Influence: Increased participation in quarterly planning, OKR setting, and roadmap validation by shaping how data is used to assess opportunity, risk, and performance.
  • Methodological Depth: Development in areas such as experimentation design, segmentation models, retention analysis, or funnel diagnostics—based on business needs and personal interest.
  • Cross-Divisional Exposure: Opportunities to support or collaborate with teams outside Seller Experience, such as Platform, Fulfillment, or Buyer Experience, depending on project scope.
  • Path to Seniority: Clear growth path toward a Senior Data Analyst role or hybrid Product-Data role, depending on profile and performance.
  • Professional Development: Access to training resources, cross-team learning, and potential mentorship by senior analysts in the centralized Data & AI function.

This role is ideal for a data-driven professional who thrives in fast-paced, product-focused environments and wants to make a real impact on how sellers interact with one of the largest eCommerce platforms in the region. The Data Analyst – Seller Experience will work at the intersection of user behavior, product strategy, and performance optimization, turning complex data into simple, actionable insights.

We value structured thinking, proactive collaboration, and a strong sense of ownership. You’ll be part of a team where your input will directly shape what gets built, how it's measured, and how success is defined across multiple product surfaces. You’ll work closely with a diverse mix of product managers, designers, and content teams, and be supported by modern tools and a growing analytics culture.

If you're looking for a role where you can influence both the what and the why of product decisions—while continuously sharpening your analytical and business skills—this is the place to grow.

What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

Per l'headquarter di Milano ricerchiamo un/a:

                                                                                                   Data Analyst 

La risorsa, inserita all’interno del Dipartimento Corporate Product Master, si occuperà di coordinare e svolgere le attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate dell’area di competenza, in collaborazione con tutte le funzioni coinvolte. 

Principali attività:


Analisi delle caratteristiche di prodotto, creazione anagrafica del prodotto stesso sui vari sistemi in uso nel Gruppo.
Coordinamento con le funzioni coinvolte nel processo di definizione e costificazione del prodotto.
Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate (divulgare il processo e le procedure relative al PIM, analisi della situazione anagrafica locale, verifica discrepanze con anagrafica Corporate, sistemazione delle anomalie, ecc)
Analisi EDI per il processo di data exchange, per identificare mancanze e soluzioni, ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati di gestione Mapei affinché il processo possa svilupparsi verso terze parti in maniera lineare
In ambito E-commerce worldwide, l'attività prevede lo studio delle regole internazionali di interscambio dati; l'analisi, la preparazione e l'interfacciamento di tutti i dati di catalogo, in modo da automatizzare il processo di comunicazione da e verso Clienti/Fornitori.


Requisiti richiesti:


Laurea in Informatica, Ing, Gestionale, Economia, Statistica, Matematica
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3-5 anni in ruoli di Data Analyst
Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Power BI, Power Pivot
Conoscenze di project management e/o gestionale per co-ordinamento attività roll-out
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilità a trasferte
Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilità, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento


Ulteriori informazioni:


Contratto: da valutare in base alla seniority del candidato.
Sede di lavoro: Milano


Filosofia aziendale: 


Innovazione e specializzazione 
Internazionalizzazione 
Sostenibilità sociale e ambientale
Persone al centro
Pari opportunità e inclusione


Benefits:


Formazione continua e sviluppo
Welfare aziendale
Fondi CCNL (Assicurazione sanitaria e pensionistica)
Convenzioni aziendali 


Chi siamo:

Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

                                                 MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

L’azienda garantisce il trattamento dei dati ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo n. 2016/679, rinviando all’informativa privacy disponibile proseguendo con la presente candidatura. La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi.  (L. 903/77). 

Esplora le Opportunità di carriera sul sito www.mapei.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 4 anos de experiência em funções de Data Analyst;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de PowerBI;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Insights and Analytics Internship
Description:
UNISCITI AL TEAM

Se ti interessa l’ambito Data Insights & Analytics e vuoi lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, questa è l’opportunità per te!




COSA FAREMO INSIEME

Supportare con dati e insights, allineare gli input al progetto Segmented Execution (mantenimento assortimento, opportunità di sviluppo, principali gap da colmare)
Supportare il Data Analytics & AI Manager e i colleghi nel fornire aggiornamenti all'organizzazione attraverso comunicazioni sia agli utenti finali che agli altri stakeholder coinvolti (principalmente Sales e Trade Marketing)
Creare report, visualizzare i dati e creare dashboard (report basati su PowerBI)
Supportare i processi di data inventory e gestione dei dati (coordinare e archiviare le attività di mappatura dei dati)
Acquisire conoscenze e agire come esperto delle fonti di dati e dei risultati dei modelli verso l'organizzazione







COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Prevediamo un inserimento in stage dalla durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga, oltre a:

Work-life balance: possibilità di lavoro da remoto e orari flessibili
Opportunità di crescita: investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale
Ambiente inclusivo: accogliamo la diversità e valorizziamo l’inclusione




SEI LA PERSONA GIUSTA SE…

Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacità analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
Hai la capacità di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacità relazionali
Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sarà considerato un vantaggio




DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilità di svolgere attività in smartworking 12 giorni al mese




SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, è il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‑Cola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondovì, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all’imbottigliamento dei prodotti dell’azienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, più forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.




LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversità delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunità a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo




Le ricerche sono rivolte ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). I candidati sono invitati a leggere sul nostro sito: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/

l’informativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).




Non ti abbiamo ancora convinto?

Note dalla tua recruiter Elisa: “Se pensi che questa opportunità sia per te, anche se non soddisfi tutti i requisiti, candidati comunque..potresti essere la persona di cui abbiamo bisogno. Cosa aspetti? Corri a candidarti e..let’s open up a moment that refresh us all!”

  • Supportare con dati e insights, allineare gli input al progetto Segmented Execution (mantenimento assortimento, opportunità di sviluppo, principali gap da colmare)
  • Supportare il Data Analytics & AI Manager e i colleghi nel fornire aggiornamenti all'organizzazione attraverso comunicazioni sia agli utenti finali che agli altri stakeholder coinvolti (principalmente Sales e Trade Marketing)
  • Creare report, visualizzare i dati e creare dashboard (report basati su PowerBI)
  • Supportare i processi di data inventory e gestione dei dati (coordinare e archiviare le attività di mappatura dei dati)
  • Acquisire conoscenze e agire come esperto delle fonti di dati e dei risultati dei modelli verso l'organizzazione



COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Prevediamo un inserimento in stage dalla durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga, oltre a:

  • Work-life balance: possibilità di lavoro da remoto e orari flessibili
  • Opportunità di crescita: investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale
  • Ambiente inclusivo: accogliamo la diversità e valorizziamo l’inclusione


SEI LA PERSONA GIUSTA SE…

  • Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
  • Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
  • Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacità analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
  • Hai la capacità di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacità relazionali
  • Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
  • Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sarà considerato un vantaggio


DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilità di svolgere attività in smartworking 12 giorni al mese


SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, è il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‑Cola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondovì, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all’imbottigliamento dei prodotti dell’azienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, più forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.


LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversità delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunità a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo


Le ricerche sono rivolte ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). I candidati sono invitati a leggere sul nostro sito: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/

l’informativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).


Non ti abbiamo ancora convinto?

Note dalla tua recruiter Elisa: “Se pensi che questa opportunità sia per te, anche se non soddisfi tutti i requisiti, candidati comunque..potresti essere la persona di cui abbiamo bisogno. Cosa aspetti? Corri a candidarti e..let’s open up a moment that refresh us all!”

Title: Data Analyst E-commerce - Flip.ro
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.




We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro




What you’ll have to do:




Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.




What makes you a good fit:




2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.




What we’ve prepared for you:




The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover




#midsenior




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Scandit FINLAND




Imagine the what. Build the how.
Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.




Your opportunity




As a Data Analyst in the Data Team, you will turn data into insights and support product managers, engineering teams, and other key stakeholders in decision-making based on data. You will also be heavily involved in the ShelfView product operations process as well as team internal reporting, KPI tracking, and data processing.





Analyse data and create visualizations in dashboards


Ingest, clean, and enhance static datasets like product catalogs


Drive on-off data handling needs and help to automate repetitive processes


Collaborate with other teams to turn data into knowledge and understanding





Who we look for





Degree in Data Analytics, Engineering, or a related field


2-3 years of work experience in Data Analysis.


Experience using Python to read, modify, and enhance data and use APIs to access production data


Curious mindset to explore hidden insights and work hands-on with data


Ability to start from a question and develop answers based on data


Familiarity with SQL queries, databases, and visualization tools (Looker Studio, PowerBI)


Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


Eligible to work in Poland or Finland





The good stuff
Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their careers at Scandit: 





An attractive individual equity plan in a high-growth company 


Smart, people-first culture


Flexible, office, hybrid, or home working


Innovation hackathons 


Team outings 


Festive/end of year all company celebrations 


Your birthday off 


Learning and development opportunities


Mentoring programs


Top-notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





 




We are proud to be “GREAT PLACE TO WORK” accredited in Switzerland, the UK, the USA, Poland, France and Italy and “GREAT PLACE TO WORK FOR WELLBEING” in the UK 




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed. 




 




Imagine the What. Build the How.




“Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed.




We help you capture every opportunity. www.scandit.com

Title: Junior Analyst (Data)
Description:
About the Department




Banking Supervision carries out on-site and ongoing supervision of licensed banks. The Banking Supervision team comprises professionals with a financial services academic background, but also legal and IT professionals to support policy and supervisory work.




About the Role




As Junior Analyst you will be responsible for the following main duties:
Monitoring, quantitative and qualitative analysis of information submitted and published by credit institutions;
Draw up reporting performance assessments for credit institutions, including challenging the quality of data as submitted/published by institutions;
Utilize available data extraction and visualisation tools to interpret data and present findings
Liaison with relevant stakeholders including credit institutions, the ECB, the EBA and others in connection with ongoing and/or ad-hoc tasks;
Proactive participation in exercises and projects undertaken by the Data Team (planned and ad-hoc), including both in-house projects and those with European Supervisory Authorities (EBA, ECB, other);
Support participation in local/EBA/ECB working groups, as well as other European regulatory bodies as may be required;
Assist in the development and implementation of new data collection initiatives and analytical frameworks.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness
General office management and administrative duties including stationery orders, invoicing, coordinating attendance reports, archiving and other admin-related tasks as necessary;
Direct support to the Head of function, including scheduling and coordination within Banking Supervision and other MFSA functions.
You will also be expected to undertake any other duties that may arise depending on the exigencies of Banking Supervision and the Authority.




About You




We are looking for candidates with background in Banking, Finance, Accountancy, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or in a related subject.

The role calls for an academic qualification in a relevant field of study at National Qualification Framework Level 6 or better, duly certified by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC) or a widely recognised professional qualification at a comparable level.

Having experience working in the area of financial services, especially within compliance and/or data, will be considered an asset. Candidates with longer working experience relevant to the role, or with proven knowledge of Excel and Business Intelligence Tools (such as PowerBI) will be preferred.




If you do not have the necessary academic or professional qualifications but you have at least five (5) years of relevant experience within the financial services environment, we would still be interested in speaking with you.




Other Information




The MFSA is an Equal Opportunities Employer as certified by the NCPE (National Commission for the Protection of Equality) and is committed to a policy of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment and will take care to avoid any form of discrimination in its recruitment procedures. The MFSA reserves the right to withdraw this call at any time and not to select any of the Candidates.

It is the responsibility of applicants in possession of qualifications awarded by Universities and other similar institutions outside Malta to produce a recognition statement on comparability of qualifications issued by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC). Applicants should do so preferably at application stage or otherwise at the preliminary interview should an applicant be selected for such interview. Details can be obtained by accessing the National Commission for Further and Higher Education website on www.ncfhe.gov.mt under MQRIC heading.

The MFSA shall ensure that any processing of personal data is in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation), the Data Protection Act (Chapter 586 of the Laws of Malta) and any other relevant European Union and national law. For further details, you may refer to the Data Protection Policy on the MFSA webpage www.mfsa.mt.

Candidates are to note that the submission of any false statement/s or omission, even if unintended, may lead to the cancellation of their application and may render the candidate's appointment liable to termination.

Furthermore, please note that candidates may be asked to submit any documentation in support of the information provided, including but not limited to, proof of qualifications and Police Conduct Certificates.




Public call number: 881/2023

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Come on board with Neo Group! Here's your chance to stir things up in the iGaming scene with us. We're not just expanding; we're revolutionizing the entire game, mastering profitability with every new venture. But you know what truly fuels our drive? It's people like you. Join us as we embark on a journey to redefine gaming on a global scale.

We are currently seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team at Neo Group. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to provide valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities:


Ensure the accuracy and alignment of comprehensive budget models with organizational goals and segments
Create detailed forecasts for costs, revenues, and other key metrics by utilizing historical data and market trends
Provide insights into profitability, growth opportunities, and cost efficiencies by analyzing data to identify key segments within the business
Analyze outcomes against established metrics and benchmarks to evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and initiatives
Regularly update stakeholders on the progress and outcomes of cost reduction and growth efforts by monitoring and tracking them
Support the achievement of company goals by closely collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Acquisition, CRM, and Business Development



Requirements


Proven ability to analyze and solve complex problems with precision
Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL, Python/KNIME, and analytical libraries (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Demonstrated mastery of Excel and its data manipulation functions
Ability to handle and analyze large datasets, and conduct statistical analysis effectively
Deep understanding of data management principles and best practices for data governance
Keen attention to detail and adeptness in working with intricate data structures
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to effectively convey complex concepts
Experience in the iGaming industry will be considered a valuable advantage.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.



Benefits

🚀 Join us on an exciting journey to shape and revolutionize a new brand in the market

💼 Get ready to enjoy a comprehensive compensation and benefits package designed to enrich your work-life balance and well-being. This package includes a competitive salary, health insurance coverage, access to our on-site gym for a healthy lifestyle, complimentary breakfast and lunch to fuel your day, and a range of diverse social events to foster team spirit, belonging and collaboration

🌍 Experience an international work environment with a passionate, motivated and professional team

🏢 Be a part of our modern office space in Ta'Xbiex, conveniently located close to all amenities and one of Malta's sought-after marinas

Being part of Neo Group means more than just a job. It's about being a part of a vibrant community with over 40 nationalities across 8 global locations. As we embrace a thrilling phase of hyper-growth and scale-up, our success is fueled by the diversity and talent of our team—potentially including you!

Explore Neo Group Further:

For more details about life and careers at Neo Group, visit our Career Website connect with us on Instagram, and engage with us on LinkedIn.

Ready to redefine the future of iGaming with us? Apply today and become a part of something truly spectacular!
Show more
HTML:
Come on board with Neo Group! Here's your chance to stir things up in the iGaming scene with us. We're not just expanding; we're revolutionizing the entire game, mastering profitability with every new venture. But you know what truly fuels our drive? It's people like you. Join us as we embark on a journey to redefine gaming on a global scale.

We are currently seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team at Neo Group. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to provide valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the accuracy and alignment of comprehensive budget models with organizational goals and segments
  • Create detailed forecasts for costs, revenues, and other key metrics by utilizing historical data and market trends
  • Provide insights into profitability, growth opportunities, and cost efficiencies by analyzing data to identify key segments within the business
  • Analyze outcomes against established metrics and benchmarks to evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and initiatives
  • Regularly update stakeholders on the progress and outcomes of cost reduction and growth efforts by monitoring and tracking them
  • Support the achievement of company goals by closely collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Acquisition, CRM, and Business Development


Requirements

  • Proven ability to analyze and solve complex problems with precision
  • Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL, Python/KNIME, and analytical libraries (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
  • Demonstrated mastery of Excel and its data manipulation functions
  • Ability to handle and analyze large datasets, and conduct statistical analysis effectively
  • Deep understanding of data management principles and best practices for data governance
  • Keen attention to detail and adeptness in working with intricate data structures
  • Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to effectively convey complex concepts
  • Experience in the iGaming industry will be considered a valuable advantage.
  • Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


Benefits

🚀 Join us on an exciting journey to shape and revolutionize a new brand in the market

💼 Get ready to enjoy a comprehensive compensation and benefits package designed to enrich your work-life balance and well-being. This package includes a competitive salary, health insurance coverage, access to our on-site gym for a healthy lifestyle, complimentary breakfast and lunch to fuel your day, and a range of diverse social events to foster team spirit, belonging and collaboration

🌍 Experience an international work environment with a passionate, motivated and professional team

🏢 Be a part of our modern office space in Ta'Xbiex, conveniently located close to all amenities and one of Malta's sought-after marinas

Being part of Neo Group means more than just a job. It's about being a part of a vibrant community with over 40 nationalities across 8 global locations. As we embrace a thrilling phase of hyper-growth and scale-up, our success is fueled by the diversity and talent of our team—potentially including you!

Explore Neo Group Further:

For more details about life and careers at Neo Group, visit our Career Website connect with us on Instagram, and engage with us on LinkedIn.

Ready to redefine the future of iGaming with us? Apply today and become a part of something truly spectacular!

Title: Junior Data Analyst - (Remote - Poland)
Description:
About Jobgether

Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our companies is currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst in Poland.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support ongoing data initiatives by maintaining and enhancing existing analytics reports and dashboards. Working closely with Product Managers and Engineers, you'll play a key role in analyzing site functionality and recommending improvements. You'll use your skills in SQL, Excel, and BI tools to extract and interpret data, optimize reporting processes, and visualize meaningful insights. This is a great opportunity for an analytical mind at the beginning of their data career, eager to grow in a collaborative and dynamic environment.

Accountabilities:


Maintain and develop analytics reports and dashboards
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to analyze website functionality
Build data aggregation tables to support reporting needs
Optimize dashboard performance and load times
Communicate findings and ideas for improvements clearly across teams
Visualize data insights to support business decisions



Requirements


At least 1 year of experience as a data or web analyst
Basic knowledge of Tableau and/or other BI tools (Power BI, Qlik Sense)
Practical experience with SQL (minimum 1 year)
Strong Excel skills for data manipulation and reporting
Understanding of probability theory and statistics
English proficiency at an intermediate level or higher



Benefits


Sports compensation and medical coverage
Psychological and home-office support
Remote work options and coworking space reimbursement
Childcare budget, maternity and paternity leave
Extra paid days off for family-related events
Supportive, growth-oriented culture with open communication
High tolerance for experimentation and learning from mistakes



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

Title: ALTERNANCE | Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Position

Lorsque vous rejoignez Moët Hennessy (MH), vous entamez un parcours de carrière avec les leaders des vins, champagnes et spiritueux de luxe au sein du prestigieux groupe LVMH. Entrez dans un monde de possibilités, où les opportunités de développement de carrière à travers nos 27 Maisons, cinq régions mondiales et l'ensemble du groupe LVMH sont inégalées. Vous gérerez votre propre carrière au sein d'une main-d'œuvre passionnée et diversifiée qui s'étend sur quatre générations et combine une richesse de rôles et de compétences. L'esprit de conquête et le savoir-faire durable de nos fondateurs audacieux, passés et présents, libéreront votre créativité et vous inspireront à façonner le prochain chapitre de notre histoire intemporelle. En tant que membre de notre communauté engagée à travers le monde, et grâce aux engagements de notre programme mondial, Living Soils Living Together, vous nous aiderez à construire un héritage durable pour notre planète et pour les générations à venir.

Aux côtés de nos équipes dynamiques, vous donnerez vie aux valeurs uniques qui définissent notre parcours collectif : partage, élégance, épicurisme, intégrité et esprit de conquête.

Si vous souhaitez inspirer et être inspiré, créer des expériences et vivre le meilleur de l'artisanat, Moët Hennessy est l'endroit où vous vous épanouirez.

Job Responsibilities

Automatisation des Processus et Gestion de Projet :


Participer à l’extraction des données et l'automatisation des processus métiers liés au contrôle interne et à l’audit interne (Python, SQL, VBA, Power Automate etc.),
Travailler sur l’amélioration continue des pratiques du contrôle et audit interne en analysant les données disponibles pour identifier les tendances ou anomalies pertinentes,
Contribuer à la conception et à la maintenance des tableaux de bord Power BI pour les contrôleurs internes et auditeurs internes,
Participer à la gestion quotidienne des projets incluant la planification et le suivi des progrès via les outils de planification (ex. JIRA),
Préparer les supports de communication nécessaires pour les réunions de projet, tels que les slides PowerPoint, rapports d’avancement, comptes rendus, etc,
Assurer une communication fluide entre toutes les parties prenantes impliquées dans les missions d’audit interne et avec la communauté du Contrôle Interne,


Participer à la préparation des missions d'audit interne :


Extraction des données depuis SAP
Analyse et intégration des données dans nos rapports Power BI,
Contrôle de la cohérence des données,
Accompagnement des auditeurs dans la compréhension des données,
Participation à la réalisation des tests d’audit
Partage des conclusions avec toutes les parties prenantes (entités, maisons, etc.),
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit,


Audit IT :


Préparation des travaux d’audit IT (Demande de documents, préparation de fiches de tests, analyse des documents obtenues etc.)
Collecte, analyse et interprétation des données,
Réalisation d’échantillonnages et de tests,
Contribution à la rédaction des rapports d'audit


Profile

Formation & expérience :


École d'ingénieur en informatique ou Miage


Langues :


Français et Anglais


Compétences personnelles et interpersonnelles :


Bac+4/5
Connaissance des langages de programmation (Python, SQL, VBA)
Maîtrise d’Excel et Power BI
Connaissance des systèmes d’information (SAP est un plus)
Rigueur, agilité, sens du service, curiosité
Esprit d’équipe, initiative et autonomie
Connaissance des principes de contrôle interne et d'audit interne est un plus


Additional Information


Dates : A partir de Septembre/Octobre 2025
Lieu : Paris 7ème
Remboursement des transports à 75%
Carte de tickets-restaurant à 50%
Show more

Additional Information

  • Lieu : Paris 7ème
  • Remboursement des transports à 75%
  • Carte de tickets-restaurant à 50%

Title: Internship in Data Analysis and Reporting
Description:
Job description:



Data Analysis and Reporting Intern

Role Overview: As a Data Analysis and Reporting Intern, you will have the opportunity to support our corporate tutor in various critical activities related to data analysis and reporting.

Key Responsibilities: 

Data Warranty Analysis: Assist in analyzing warranty data submitted by our network.
Data Processing and Comparison: Process and compare data to generate insightful analyses.
Data Importation to Data Lake: Manage the importation of data into our centralized data lake, designed to store, process, and protect vast amounts of structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
Comprehensive Data Handling: Work with diverse data sets from the warranty database, regardless of size constraints.
Structured Report Generation: Develop structured reports to present complex data analyses in a clear and accessible manner.

 

Why Join Us?

Hands-On Experience: Gain practical experience with data analysis tools and techniques.
Mentorship: Receive guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
Innovative Environment: Be part of a forward-thinking company that values creativity and innovation.

 

Ideal Candidate: 

Recent Graduate: A recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Management Engineering or a related field.
Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Tech-Savvy: Familiarity with data processing tools and software.
Detail-Oriented: Excellent attention to detail and the ability to manage large data sets.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills to present data findings effectively.

The selected candidate will be offered a 6-month extracurricular internship, including expense reimbursement and access to the company cafeteria. The position requires a commitment of 37 hours per week, from Monday to Friday.  

Internship location: Pontedera

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Arkadium our purpose is to have fun while creating fun - and that's exactly what we've been doing for 20 years. We're the creators behind the world's most-played games. From the Solitaire that came on your Windows machine, to hundreds of other games you've come to know and love - you can find our games on Arkadium.com, iOS, Android, and lots of other big sites worldwide.

As a proud Evergreen business our values of Fierce Drive, Positive Energy and Living Full Lives are the driving force behind how we run and the choices we make.

We're privately held (aka stable and reasonable about growth), founder-led (aka passionate about our craft) and we consistently rank as a "Best Place to Work" (aka not your typical games company).

Interested in becoming an Arkadian? We'd love to hear from you!

Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in connecting business strategy with data-driven insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, and Operations, to analyze key metrics, interpret trends, and develop actionable recommendations that drive business growth. Beyond technical skills, we seek a candidate who can bridge the gap between data and decision-making, ensuring that insights translate into impactful business strategies.

What You'll Do:


Conduct ad-hoc analyses using statistical methods to answer business-critical questions.
Interpret and translate data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Define and own data processes, from event tracking and data collection to building structured datasets and dashboards.
Develop and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and other business units to identify data needs and align analytics efforts with company objectives.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through proactive auditing, validation, and monitoring.
Work with engineering and data teams to enhance data pipelines, implement tracking strategies, and optimize data models.



Requirements

What You Bring:


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with expertise in statistical methods and hypothesis testing.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with Python and/or R for data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with a problem-solving mindset to drive data-backed decisions.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in web analytics and understanding of website performance metrics.
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (e.g., Azure).
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) for data visualization.
Hands-on experience with Databricks or other big data processing platforms.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and marketing analytics.



Benefits

Why Join Arkadium?


High-Impact Role - Work at the intersection of strategy, execution, and technology, influencing the company's trajectory.
Fast-Paced, High-Growth Environment - No two days are the same. You'll be challenged, stretched, and given autonomy to make an impact.
Leadership & Growth Opportunity - Manage a small but high-impact team and take ownership of critical company initiatives.
Collaborative, Agile Culture - We move fast, work hard, and have fun while doing it.
Shape the Future - Be part of a company that is redefining browser gaming and driving innovation in the space.



Benefits


Competitive compensation with structured performance and career development check-ins.
Meaningful health insurance.
Meal allowance.
Personal development budget to fuel your passions and desire to learn (Arkadians are taking classes in not only Excel and leadership, but also interior design and even swimming!)
Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.
Professional Coaching Budget .
Time off from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day so we can all enjoy the holidays.
Summer Fridays: 4 Fridays off throughout the Summer to have more fun in the sun.
A unique culture of transparency, true teamwork and fun.


This role is open to candidates based in Portugal. Business hours are 9-18 WEST (UTC+1). For candidates based in the Lisbon area, this role will transition to a hybrid model, requiring in-person presence. For candidates located outside the Lisbon area in Portugal, a different cadence of in-person presence may apply, depending on proximity.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Tableau)
Description:
En VISEO Barcelona buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo de profesionales en el área de Data Analytics. Si te gustan los nuevos retos, y quieres progresar en tu carrera profesional con un Equipo de expertos con tecnologías a la última, únete al equipo VISEO en proyectos internacionales.

Tu Rol:


Formular y mantener paneles de control que automaticen informes.
Diseño y creación de aplicaciones internas utilizando Tableau, Python.
Big Data en entornos AWS.


Tu Perfil:


Experiencia de 2 o 3 años como Data Analyst utilizando Tableau como herramienta principal.
Experiencia con Python.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación para realizar toma de requisitos con clientes.
Dominio avanzando de Excel y SQL.
Nivel alto de inglés.


¿Qué podemos aportarte?


Oportunidad de incorporarte en una empresa pionera a nivel tecnológico.
Formación continua técnica y competencial.
Contrato Indefinido.
Beneficios Sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al remoto, ticket restaurant, transporte, 26 días de vacaciones al año etc.).
Conciliación familiar y laboral gracias a la flexibilidad y la posibilidad de teletrabajo.
Salario competitivo según la experiencia aportada.


Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:


Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.
Show more

  • Dominio avanzando de Excel y SQL.
  • Nivel alto de inglés.

¿Qué podemos aportarte?

  • Oportunidad de incorporarte en una empresa pionera a nivel tecnológico.
  • Formación continua técnica y competencial.
  • Contrato Indefinido.
  • Beneficios Sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al remoto, ticket restaurant, transporte, 26 días de vacaciones al año etc.).
  • Conciliación familiar y laboral gracias a la flexibilidad y la posibilidad de teletrabajo.
  • Salario competitivo según la experiencia aportada.

Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:

  • Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
  • Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
  • Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.




What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.




Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.




You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.




Why Working With Us?

Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.




Our Values

Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.




Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My Westmeath based client is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst coming from a Financial Services / Insurance back ground to join a growing team. This is a permanent role with a requirement of 4 days onsite. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Transform data into meaningful information and actionable insight.
Use a variety of tools and query methods to analyse data and identify opportunities and solutions.
Act as a link between data engineering and visualisation teams to maximise the use and accessibility of data across the business.
Present analytical findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Enhance automated reporting with added insight that drives action and business value.
Support a culture shift towards data-informed decision making.
Help design and embed strong data management and reporting standards.
Contribute to data governance practices and ensure consistent application of analytics methodologies.
Develop and promote standardised approaches to data use and interpretation.




Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Proficiency in SQL for querying, mining, and segmenting data.
Strong quantitative analysis skills with experience deriving insights from data.
At least 2 years of experience with tools such as R or Python.
Good understanding of database structures and data architecture.
Familiarity with BI strategies and their application in a business setting.
Experience with tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Experience in financial services; insurance sector experience is a strong advantage.




Personal Attributes

Independent and experienced subject matter expert with the ability to work autonomously and deliver best practice solutions.
Positive, can-do attitude and the ability to quickly grasp new business and technical environments.
Strong relationship-building skills and the ability to confidently manage stakeholder expectations, including those at an executive level.




Skills:

Data Analyst Data Insights Data Analysis Reporting SQL Python Tableau
