Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE


Understand company requirements and define KPIs for dashboard development.
Collect, clean, and transform datasets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards for operational risk management.
Ensure agility in updating dashboards according to stakeholders' needs.
Continuously improve dashboard accuracy and usability by monitoring data quality.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Make recommendations to enhance dashboard production and data-driven decision-making.
Promote a data-driven culture within CIB by developing new data models.


YOUR PROFILE


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.Experience as a Data Analyst, specializing in dashboard development.
Proficiency in Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, SQL, and ETL tools.
Experience with DataIKU.
Basic Python skills, preferably with Pandas.
Strong understanding of data visualization techniques.
Experience in Big Data technologies (PySpark, Presto, Airflow).
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX.
Familiarity with descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing.


What You'll Love About Working Here


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback;
Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Data Analyst | Join a Fast-Growing FoodTech Startup in Madrid







👋 Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. 🍽️

Combining cutting-edge technology 💻 with a deep passion for food and hospitality ❤️‍🔥, we’ve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 60,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ✨







🎯 About the role

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who’s passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams—this might be your next role.







🛠️ Responsibilities

🔍 Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
📊 Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights
📈 Generate reports and visualizations to communicate findings with clarity and impact
🤝 Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
🧰 Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







✅ Requirements

🎓 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
💼 At least 2 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
🧠 Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
📈 Hands-on experience (2+ years) with HubSpot and Amplitude
🚀 Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment
🌍 Fluency in English and Spanish
📊 Nice to have: Experience with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI







Why choose us?

💼 Positive Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that values personal well-being and team spirit.
⚖️ Work-Life Balance: We prioritize flexibility and support so you can flourish both professionally and personally.
📚 Employee Development: Paid training and workshops to help you grow and achieve your career goals.
💰 Competitive Compensation: We offer attractive salaries and annual bonuses to reward your impact.
🌴 Paid Time Off: Enjoy 25 vacation days per year to relax, recharge, and explore your passions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
***Relocation opportunity to Germany***




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Düsseldorf, Germany (Hybrid – 3 days a week)




We’re seeking a Data Analyst to join my client's dynamic Product team. In this role, you’ll analyze user behavior to generate insights, support A/B testing, and deliver actionable data to drive product enhancements.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze user behavior to generate actionable product insights
Support A/B testing from setup to analysis
Monitor data to identify trends, anomalies, and test outcomes
Deliver datasets to support data-driven features
Work on core product areas: search, homepage, filters, and map experience
Contribute to projects exploring AI tools, including AI-powered search features
Focused on improving product and user experience




Essential Skills:

Strong attitude and willingness to learn
Experience with R, Python, SQL, Hadoop, BigQuery
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience with A/B testing
Exposure to consumer-facing apps
Comfortable working with B2B tech products
At least 2 years of Data Analyst experience (open to more experience)




Benefits:

Personalized coaching, free online learning courses, and access to a fully equipped campus library
Relocation and visa support for Germany
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours
Daily canteen lunch, free drinks, and snacks
Health insurance, pension plan
Free on-campus gym and much more!




If you are interested and fit the bill, please apply today as we are scheduling interviews immediately.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CHI SIAMO

Edenred è leader nel settore degli employee benefit e offre alle aziende soluzioni digitali per migliorare la qualità di vita e il benessere delle persone che lavorano, dalla pausa pranzo, al tempo libero, fino alla cura della persona e alla mobilità sostenibile.

La nostra piattaforma digitale collega 60 milioni di utenti e oltre 2 milioni di affiliati in 45 Paesi attraverso circa 1 milione di aziende clienti. In Italia, l’ecosistema coinvolge oltre 2,5 milioni di beneficiari, 100 mila aziende clienti e 150 mila partner convenzionati.

Oggi il mondo è cambiato e noi ci impegniamo ad ideare soluzioni sempre più smart per supportare le funzioni HR e rispondere efficacemente alle esigenze correlate alle nuove abitudini lavorative.




“Enrich connections. For good.”, questo il purpose del Gruppo: sviluppare ed arricchire le connessioni per rafforzare le imprese e promuovere soluzioni inclusive, ponendo al centro non solo le persone, ma anche l’ambiente e il territorio.

Per noi, la diversità delle persone è un punto di forza e di ricchezza in grado di riflettere la diversità dei nostri clienti e stakeholder. Siamo inoltre impegnati nella protezione dell’ambiente, disegnando soluzioni spostenibili per la mobilità e lo spreco alimentare con l’impegno di raggiungere le zero emissioni nette entro il 2050.




Edenred è quotata alla Borsa Euronext di Parigi ed è inclusa nei seguenti indici: CAC 40, CAC 40 ESG, CAC Next 20, CAC Large 60, Euronext Tech Leaders, Euronext 100, FTSE4Good e MSCI Europe.

Vuoi sapere di più su di noi? Vai su https://www.edenred.it/




YOU WILL VIBE WITH US

La risorsa ricercata sarà inserita nel team di Business Intelligence & Customer Value Management, riportando direttamente al Head of BI & CVM, e lavorerà a stretto contatto con le diverse business unit.




Principali attività:

Analizzare, modellare e trasformare i dati per supportare le esigenze di reporting e analisi dei diversi stakeholder;
Garantire la qualità, consistenza e affidabilità dei dati a supporto delle decisioni di business;
Data Storytelling: sintetizzare i dati, individuare insight rilevanti e presentarli in modo efficace e comprensibile;
Applicare le best practice di modellazione dati e di progettazione architetturale in ambito Business Intelligence.




WE WILL VIBE WITH YOU

Passione per il cliente, rispetto, immaginazione, semplicità e spirito imprenditoriale sono i valori che ricerchiamo nelle nostre persone. Se ti riconosci ed hai voglia di metterti in gioco in un ambiente stimolante e multinazionale inviaci la tua candidatura e diventa anche tu un* Edenreder !

Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria o comprovate competenze equivalenti;
Esperienza di 2 anni in ambito Analytics con tecnologie Microsoft;
Requisiti tecnici: Linguaggio SQL; Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service; DAX, Power Query (M); Utilizzo degli strumenti Microsoft Office 365, in particolare Excel; Concetti base di Data Warehousing (ETL, Stage, DWH) o Data Lakehousing (Medallion Architecture); Concetti base di Data Modeling: star/snowflake schema, relazioni tra tabelle di dimensioni e fatti, misure.




OTHER DETAILS

Contratto: tempo indeterminato
Smart-working (10 gg/mese),
Ticket Restaurant®
Piano Welfare
Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa e assicurazione vita professionale/extraprofessionale

Show more

La risorsa ricercata sarà inserita nel team di Business Intelligence & Customer Value Management, riportando direttamente al Head of BI & CVM, e lavorerà a stretto contatto con le diverse business unit.


Principali attività:

  • Analizzare, modellare e trasformare i dati per supportare le esigenze di reporting e analisi dei diversi stakeholder;
  • Garantire la qualità, consistenza e affidabilità dei dati a supporto delle decisioni di business;
  • Data Storytelling: sintetizzare i dati, individuare insight rilevanti e presentarli in modo efficace e comprensibile;
  • Applicare le best practice di modellazione dati e di progettazione architetturale in ambito Business Intelligence.


WE WILL VIBE WITH YOU

Passione per il cliente, rispetto, immaginazione, semplicità e spirito imprenditoriale sono i valori che ricerchiamo nelle nostre persone. Se ti riconosci ed hai voglia di metterti in gioco in un ambiente stimolante e multinazionale inviaci la tua candidatura e diventa anche tu un* Edenreder !

  • Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria o comprovate competenze equivalenti;
  • Esperienza di 2 anni in ambito Analytics con tecnologie Microsoft;
  • Requisiti tecnici: Linguaggio SQL; Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service; DAX, Power Query (M); Utilizzo degli strumenti Microsoft Office 365, in particolare Excel; Concetti base di Data Warehousing (ETL, Stage, DWH) o Data Lakehousing (Medallion Architecture); Concetti base di Data Modeling: star/snowflake schema, relazioni tra tabelle di dimensioni e fatti, misure.


OTHER DETAILS

  • Contratto: tempo indeterminato
  • Smart-working (10 gg/mese),
  • Ticket Restaurant®
  • Piano Welfare
  • Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa e assicurazione vita professionale/extraprofessionale

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

At Sanofi, we’re committed to transform the practice of medicine through break-through science. Within Sanofi, Manufacturing & Supply (M&S) is the bridge between Science and Patients, ensuring all patients get their dose reliably, that new medicines are launched faster to cover unmet needs and that they can be delivered affordably across the globe. At Sanofi we are convinced that Manufacturing is, and must in the future increasingly be, a competitive advantage and that digital unlocks every next step in that journey.

Join Sanofi Manufacturing & Supply (M&S): Where Innovation Meets Life-Saving Impact in the Heart of Lyon!

Imagine working in a vibrant startup environment, right in Lyon's bustling city center! 🏙️

Sanofi M&S offers an unparalleled playground at the intersection of drug development, advanced manufacturing, and cutting-edge AI. Here, you'll:


Support 12 blockbuster launch teams and 40 global factories across R&D and M&S
Work with real-time IoT data from state-of-the-art production and laboratory equipment
Contribute to one of the strongest treatment pipelines in biopharma
Collaborate with world-class scientists, engineers, and experts driving digital transformation


As part of our Digital M&S Accelerator, you'll develop high-value digital products to:


Accelerate yearly launches of 3-5 new blockbuster medicines (€1B+ annual revenue each)
Create best-in-class digitalized "Lighthouse" factories
Drive manufacturing performance to reduce costs by over €500M in the next five years


But wait, there's more! 🎉

Your innovative journey takes place in a prime location:


Embrace the startup vibe in our cutting-edge office space
Enjoy countless amenities right at your doorstep – from nice cafés to restaurants
Benefit from excellent public transport connections for an easy commute
Experience the perfect blend of work and life in one of France's most dynamic cities Ready to shape the future of biomanufacturing, make a real-world impact on patients' lives, and do it all from an amazing location


Join us in Lyon and be part of something extraordinary! 🚀💡

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis and provide input to solution design and architecture to ensure the solution meets requirements
Actively solicit stakeholder feedback on solutions and drive improvements as needed
Extracts, aggregates, manipulates, categorizes, cleans, and transforms data associated within an identified problem space
Work in close collaboration with Data scientists and data engineers to identify the right data and define proper data models
Performs exploratory data analysis and feature generation
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create compelling data stories through great visualizations using cutting-edge technologies
Drive alignment across stakeholders on enterprise data models and definitions
Partner with stakeholders to get buy-in on, develop, and implement Sanofi’s data management standards, policies, and best practices
Implement data management and data governance best practices and standards
Recommend KPIs and develop reports to monitor adoption of and adherence to data management standards
Participate to the data analyst community of practice


As a Data Analyst, you will have a direct impact on the business by deriving insights from Data and ensuring the quality, usability, and security of Sanofi’s data. You are analytical, creative, and collaborative. You have keen attention to detail and take the time to understand our stakeholders’ data needs and challenges. You continually seek to improve your knowledge of new technologies and industry standards to drive the development of simple, yet effective solutions. You enjoy partnering with stakeholders to design and implement data management best practices and procedures. You are a self-starter, see challenges as opportunities, and are results oriented. You take pride knowing your work enables innovation and helping Sanofi build better solution.

Experience

About you


Strong understanding of databases and data structures
Exposure to tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality
Strong ability to identify, quantify, and effectively raise business risks associated with data quality or non-compliance
Experience developing best Lean & Agile practices, policies, and/or procedures
Rigorous, attention to detail to map data systems and curious to understand what is behind each data field
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations such as GxP
Experience in a healthcare company, manufacturing and supply field or chemical industry is a strong plus


Soft Skills


Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results
Service-oriented, flexible, positive team player
Self-motivated, takes initiative
Problem solving & critical thinking


Technical Skills


Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data & Python
Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods
Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus
One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams


Education


Preferred qualifications: Master’s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics


Languages


English, French


Why choose us?


We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team
Contribute to a company that is not only a leader in healthcare but also a pioneer in digital transformation, shaping the future of global health
Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave
Play an instrumental part in creating best practice within our manufacturing facility


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Title: Intern Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

At IKEA, we do things a little differently. We think differently, act differently, and work differently as well. We like to break things—like rules—and then make things, like music-playing lamps and beds disguised as sofas. It’s all part of our vision: to create a better everyday life for the many people. By 2030, we hope to help millions more look forward to going home. Maybe you can help us? 

About The Area 

Core Business Retail Concept is dedicated to protecting, expanding, and developing the IKEA Concept and the IKEA Brand in both existing and new markets. This includes sharing IKEA knowledge and learning across the franchise system.  Retail Concept consists of the following areas: Brand & Marketing, Expansion, Learning, Retail Experience and Retail Concept Operations.  

About The Assignment 

We offer unique IKEA specialist competence in developing, improving, designing, establishing, and operating IKEA Customer Meeting Points based on a market approach across all IKEA markets. Customer Meeting Points include IKEA Stores, Small Stores, Pick-up & Points, Plan Shops, and Plan & Order Points. We coach, mentor, support, and challenge IKEA retailers in their expansion plans and collaborate with our IKEA franchisees in over 50 countries worldwide. We thrive in a multicultural environment where we comfortably use English (spoken and written) to communicate. We co-create and innovate IKEA retail architecture, transforming market and business needs into outstanding customer experiences. 

Do you want to take part in supporting the designing of IKEA customer meeting places worldwide through the analysis, presentation and clear sharing of data and information? Would you like to work in an open-minded and international environment? Then we are looking for you! 

About The Role 

We are looking for a data analyst intern for a 12-month period at our office in Malmö, starting September 2025. During your internship, you will be a member of our Process, Service and Tools team.

Your tasks will include: 


Working with our CMP dimensioning team to collate, analyze and share physical CMP design and As Built data. (CMP dimensioning is our team and digital tool which supports the sizing and allocation of spaces within an IKEA CMP based on market and business needs)
Work with and support in the capacity planning and forecasting for incoming projects and internal resources.
Provide business support to projects which develop our service offer for CMP design to our franchisees


About You 

We believe that you are newly graduated from university studies within for example business, data analysis, statistics or other relevant degrees and are eager to start your first job in the field.

You are a driven person with a genuine interest in exploring, understanding and sharing business data and analysis in a clear way and are able to clearly demonstrate this by giving examples. You have strong interpersonal skills and find it easy to build relationships and earn trust, embodying IKEA values. You take responsibility for actions and results, making things happen. You should have: 


At least 3 years of study within relevant degrees related to the role 
An interest in retail design across various scale projects. 
Good skills in understanding and communicating data and its usability and impact on end users. 
Strong social skills and the ability to work independently. 
Fluency in English (spoken and written). 
Experience working with excel based systems, project and resource management tools


You would benefit most from this internship if you are a proactive person, as this role will allow you to take on more responsibilities as you demonstrate your capability. 

Additional Information

This role is full-time temporary employment and based in Malmö, Sweden. You will report to Process and Service Manager. If you would like to know more about the role, please connect with jim.gardner@inter.ikea.com, or if you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with recruiter linnea.dietrichson@inter.ikea.com 

Interested? 

Submit your CV and motivational letter by 23rd of May 2025. We truly want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at Inter IKEA and why you would be a great fit for this role. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means we may close the application process earlier if we find the right candidate. Don’t hesitate, submit your application as soon as possible.  We look forward to receiving your application in English!

If you would like to know more about the role, please connect with jim.gardner@inter.ikea.com, or if you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with recruiter linnea.dietrichson@inter.ikea.com 

Interested? 

Submit your CV and motivational letter by 23rd of May 2025. We truly want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at Inter IKEA and why you would be a great fit for this role. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means we may close the application process earlier if we find the right candidate. Don’t hesitate, submit your application as soon as possible.  We look forward to receiving your application in English!

Title: CRM Data Analyst
HTML:
METRO is a global leader in wholesale food and non-food distribution, serving the needs of hotels, restaurants, catering businesses (HoReCa), and independent traders.

In 2025, we were awarded the Top Employer Romania and Europe certification for the fifth consecutive year. This certification places us among the top employers locally and in Europe. Globally, we are present in 35 countries, with 150,000 employees. We are passionate about supporting the growth of over 24 million customers, which means 24 million different challenges, ambitions and dreams.

METRO Romania was the pioneer in introducing the cash & carry sales system in Romania, in October 1996. Today, METRO Romania means:

  • More than 4,000 employees
  • 30 distribution centers across the country
  • An annual turnover of 10.5 billion lei, marking a 9% growth from the previous year.
  • A total sales area of 190,000 square meters
  • GASTRONOMETRO – Our Culinary Training Center at METRO Militari, a symbol of culinary excellence, where our specialists provide cooking courses and gastronomic consulting services to over 7,500 clients.
  • LaDoiPași – The franchise network developed by METRO, now the largest network of independent stores in Romania, with over 2,400 locations.
  • The global employer branding campaign "Shape the M" in Romania - a recognition of the contribution each METRO employee makes to the success of the company.

We are professionals working for professionals. We do business with passion. It's about speed, results, courage and team spirit. If you think alike, or if you are just curious to learn, apply on this website or log on to https://cariere.metro.ro/

Diversity and inclusion are at the heart of METRO's culture, philosophy and recruitment practices. We are committed to fostering an environment that respects the diverse perspectives, experiences and backgrounds of our employees and to promoting an inclusive, fair and accessible workplace. This includes employees of all races and ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities and sexual orientations, religious and political beliefs, military background and socio-economic status or any other legally protected factor. We ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. At METRO, recruitment and hiring processes have been designed to ensure diversity by giving equal opportunities to all individuals, regardless of their diverse perspectives and backgrounds.



Job Description

Are you passionate about turning customer data into actionable insights? We're looking for a CRM Data Analyst to help us better understand and engage our customer base through smart reporting, campaign analysis, and data-driven support for key business initiatives.

What you’ll do:

  • Analyze and report on customer base evolution, helping the business make informed decisions;

  • Deliver performance reports for Call Center and Net Promoter Score (NPS) trends;

  • Run and evaluate SMS campaigns targeting specific customer groups;

  • Provide support for the GDPR permissions collection initiative in stores;

  • Contribute to the ARES Program by updating data (closed companies, former employees, key accounts), sending SMS notifications, and preparing related reports and evaluations.



Qualifications

What we’re looking for:

  • Knowledge of Retail / Wholesale business operations (METRO experience is a big plus);

  • Experience or strong interest in SQL, Python, Google Cloud Platform / BigQuery and Looker;

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills – you enjoy working with others across functions;

  • Curiosity and willingness to learn new tools and business processes;

  • Interest in both data analysis and understanding the business logic behind CRM activities.



Additional Information

We're ready to train and reward you as a #METROCHAMPION:

  • Lunch and holiday are provided by us through meal vouchers and holiday bonus;
  • Your health is a priority for us, that's why you benefit from private medical insurance;
  • Your performance is rewarded with team or individual bonuses;
  • You get extra days off for various occasions;
  • You have access to psychological, financial and legal counselling for you and your family;
  • You get holiday and special occasion bonuses (Christmas, Easter, 1st of June);
  • You get a referral bonus for new #METROCHAMPIONS for our team;
  • You get discounts on medical and sports subscriptions;
  • We value stability and reward it with extra vacation days and loyalty bonuses.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.

About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark.

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.

Responsibilities:


Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians.
Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date.
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards.
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems.
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency.


Key Competencies:


University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies.
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner.
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits.
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape.
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members.
Able to speak and communicate in English
Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications.


Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @ nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

People Analytics and Measurement is a team composed of over seventy data and analytics professionals who serve internal firm customers.

The Business Intelligence group is responsible for all reporting, performance metrics, and descriptive analytics enabling the firm to understand and optimize our people operations, and measure the impact of our strategic initiatives.

The team works in a highly collaborative environment, partnering with other teams to deliver meaningful innovation in people analytics.

Your Impact

As a People Analytics and Measurement Data Analyst, you will work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers to extract, clean, and analyze the firm's people data.

You will develop fluency in the firm's people systems and combine this with your analytical knowledge to help translate business questions into rigorous analysis.

You will be responsible for supporting projects that examine the firm’s feedback and evaluation processes, headcount planning, staffing, feedback, surveys and organizational health and performance metrics.

You will communicate the results of the analysis to the team's internal clients, helping them understand the results and suggesting potential actions supported by the results.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor's or graduate degree with focus or specialization in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, social science research, operations research, econometrics, or similar field
1+ years of relevant professional experience in analytics demonstrating success as an individual contributor within a broader team
Solid analytical and data management skills
Ability to plan, prioritize and manage multiple projects, and to work effectively under pressure and with shifting priorities
Flexibility in working style, eager to collaborate with a team (often virtually) and to engage in independent work, based on project and other circumstances
Ability to understand and communicate the meaning of analyses with individuals in a wide range of strategic and operational roles, in both written and oral form
Technical and analytic experience including experience with analytical tools and software such as R (preferred), Python, Tableau, Alteryx, or other programming experience
Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving data from relational databases
Exploratory data analysis to understand the characteristics of a data set and identify patterns
Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel, including manipulating large datasets
Intuitive understanding of what the analysis implies and how it would be affected by changes in assumptions
Comfort with dealing with ambiguity, making assumptions, and drawing conclusions
Substantial technical experience working with real-world data, including extracting it from production databases like Oracle, SQL Server, Snowflake and cleaning it to create analytically tractable data sets
Familiarity with software development methodologies like Agile, including issue/workflow tracking tools like Jira and Trello and version control tools like git and GitHub
Familiarity with visualizing data using ggplot2, matplotlib, d3.js, Tableau, or similar software

Title: Data Analyst - Freelance - Amsterdam
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Analyst

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Contract Type: Freelance

Duration: 6 months

Start Date: ASAP




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse and manipulate large datasets using Python and SQL to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Create and maintain automated reporting and dashboards using Power BI.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define KPIs, business metrics, and analytical requirements.
Build statistical models and forecasts to assist with decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous data validation and cleansing techniques.
Translate complex data analysis into clear, understandable business recommendations.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in a freelance capacity.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Solid experience with Python for data analysis, automation, and building models.
Some experience working with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong ability to analyse large datasets, draw insights, and generate actionable recommendations.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data to non-technical teams.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the Finance Industry is a plus.
Familiarity with ETL processes and database management systems.
Knowledge of data privacy laws, including GDPR compliance.
Ability to collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

Per l'headquarter di Milano ricerchiamo un/a:

                                                                                                   Data Analyst 

La risorsa, inserita all’interno del Dipartimento Corporate Product Master, si occuperà di coordinare e svolgere le attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate dell’area di competenza, in collaborazione con tutte le funzioni coinvolte. 

Principali attività:


Analisi delle caratteristiche di prodotto, creazione anagrafica del prodotto stesso sui vari sistemi in uso nel Gruppo.
Coordinamento con le funzioni coinvolte nel processo di definizione e costificazione del prodotto.
Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate (divulgare il processo e le procedure relative al PIM, analisi della situazione anagrafica locale, verifica discrepanze con anagrafica Corporate, sistemazione delle anomalie, ecc)
Analisi EDI per il processo di data exchange, per identificare mancanze e soluzioni, ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati di gestione Mapei affinché il processo possa svilupparsi verso terze parti in maniera lineare
In ambito E-commerce worldwide, l'attività prevede lo studio delle regole internazionali di interscambio dati; l'analisi, la preparazione e l'interfacciamento di tutti i dati di catalogo, in modo da automatizzare il processo di comunicazione da e verso Clienti/Fornitori.


Requisiti richiesti:


Laurea in Informatica, Ing, Gestionale, Economia, Statistica, Matematica
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 3-5 anni in ruoli di Data Analyst
Ottima conoscenza di Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Power BI, Power Pivot
Conoscenze di project management e/o gestionale per co-ordinamento attività roll-out
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilità a trasferte
Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilità, precisione, team working, analisi, organizzazione e coordinamento


Ulteriori informazioni:


Contratto: da valutare in base alla seniority del candidato.
Sede di lavoro: Milano


Filosofia aziendale: 


Innovazione e specializzazione 
Internazionalizzazione 
Sostenibilità sociale e ambientale
Persone al centro
Pari opportunità e inclusione


Benefits:


Formazione continua e sviluppo
Welfare aziendale
Fondi CCNL (Assicurazione sanitaria e pensionistica)
Convenzioni aziendali 


Chi siamo:

Mapei, fondata nel 1937 a Milano, è una realtà leader nello sviluppo, nella produzione e distribuzione di prodotti chimici e soluzioni per l'edilizia, con oltre 24 Linee di Business in grado di rispondere a qualsiasi necessità nel mondo delle costruzioni.

Attualmente il Gruppo coinvolge oltre 12.000 persone nel mondo ed è composto da 102 Consociate con 81 stabilimenti produttivi nei 5 continenti e 32 centri di ricerca.   

Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente con grande senso di appartenenza e valori. 

Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione, flessibilità e passione orientate a sviluppare le proprie competenze ed essere sempre un passo avanti.

                                                 MAPEI, il cantiere più importante per il tuo Talento!

L’azienda garantisce il trattamento dei dati ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo n. 2016/679, rinviando all’informativa privacy disponibile proseguendo con la presente candidatura. La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi.  (L. 903/77). 

Esplora le Opportunità di carriera sul sito www.mapei.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 4 anos de experiência em funções de Data Analyst;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de PowerBI;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Insights and Analytics Internship
Description:
UNISCITI AL TEAM

Se ti interessa l’ambito Data Insights & Analytics e vuoi lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, questa è l’opportunità per te!




COSA FAREMO INSIEME

Supportare con dati e insights, allineare gli input al progetto Segmented Execution (mantenimento assortimento, opportunità di sviluppo, principali gap da colmare)
Supportare il Data Analytics & AI Manager e i colleghi nel fornire aggiornamenti all'organizzazione attraverso comunicazioni sia agli utenti finali che agli altri stakeholder coinvolti (principalmente Sales e Trade Marketing)
Creare report, visualizzare i dati e creare dashboard (report basati su PowerBI)
Supportare i processi di data inventory e gestione dei dati (coordinare e archiviare le attività di mappatura dei dati)
Acquisire conoscenze e agire come esperto delle fonti di dati e dei risultati dei modelli verso l'organizzazione







COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Prevediamo un inserimento in stage dalla durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga, oltre a:

Work-life balance: possibilità di lavoro da remoto e orari flessibili
Opportunità di crescita: investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale
Ambiente inclusivo: accogliamo la diversità e valorizziamo l’inclusione




SEI LA PERSONA GIUSTA SE…

Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacità analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
Hai la capacità di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacità relazionali
Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sarà considerato un vantaggio




DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilità di svolgere attività in smartworking 12 giorni al mese




SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, è il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‑Cola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondovì, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all’imbottigliamento dei prodotti dell’azienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, più forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.




LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversità delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunità a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo




Le ricerche sono rivolte ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). I candidati sono invitati a leggere sul nostro sito: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/

l’informativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).




Non ti abbiamo ancora convinto?

Note dalla tua recruiter Elisa: “Se pensi che questa opportunità sia per te, anche se non soddisfi tutti i requisiti, candidati comunque..potresti essere la persona di cui abbiamo bisogno. Cosa aspetti? Corri a candidarti e..let’s open up a moment that refresh us all!”

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

Worldpanel is the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company, we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Role Description

As a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you’ll be trained and encouraged to extract, process and validate produced data, as well as deliver and produce Ad Hoc reports and translate our stakeholders’ requirements into reporting deliverables.

If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Reasonable Adjustments

Kantar is committed to offering equal opportunities to all individuals including during the recruitment process. If you require any reasonable adjustments or assistance, please advise us in advance of your interview so that we can make the necessary arrangements.

Key outcomes


Production of Outputs for international projects using multiple formats.
Responsible for the preparation of end-client deliverables using both industry standard and Kantar-specific technology and tools.
Extracting data using different platforms/tools.
Processing and validation of produced data.
Deliver and produce Ad Hoc and ongoing reports.
Translate stakeholders’ requirements into reporting deliverables.
Ensuring quality assurance and control of the produced reports.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


Knowledge or previous experience in data manipulation is appreciated.
Be able to write, read, comprehend, reason, and perform basic mathematic calculations and data analysis.
Knowledge or previous experience with MS Excel (e.g. Advanced Formulas; Pivot Tables) is recommended.
English professional proficiency – minimum B2 Level is required.


With the following qualities…


Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrate a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work optimally within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What's in it for you?


Private health cover - option to extend to family.
Meal vouchers
Access to our 24/7 employee assistance programme (wellbeing platform)
Volunteer Leave (2 days per year)
Extra day off for your birthday
Flexible benefit allowance (annual)
Life assurance and income protection
Fixed-term contract


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst E-commerce - Flip.ro
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.




We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro




What you’ll have to do:




Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.




What makes you a good fit:




2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.




What we’ve prepared for you:




The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover




#midsenior




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Scandit FINLAND




Imagine the what. Build the how.
Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.




Your opportunity




As a Data Analyst in the Data Team, you will turn data into insights and support product managers, engineering teams, and other key stakeholders in decision-making based on data. You will also be heavily involved in the ShelfView product operations process as well as team internal reporting, KPI tracking, and data processing.





Analyse data and create visualizations in dashboards


Ingest, clean, and enhance static datasets like product catalogs


Drive on-off data handling needs and help to automate repetitive processes


Collaborate with other teams to turn data into knowledge and understanding





Who we look for





Degree in Data Analytics, Engineering, or a related field


2-3 years of work experience in Data Analysis.


Experience using Python to read, modify, and enhance data and use APIs to access production data


Curious mindset to explore hidden insights and work hands-on with data


Ability to start from a question and develop answers based on data


Familiarity with SQL queries, databases, and visualization tools (Looker Studio, PowerBI)


Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


Eligible to work in Poland or Finland





The good stuff
Here are just some of the reasons why people choose to build their careers at Scandit: 





An attractive individual equity plan in a high-growth company 


Smart, people-first culture


Flexible, office, hybrid, or home working


Innovation hackathons 


Team outings 


Festive/end of year all company celebrations 


Your birthday off 


Learning and development opportunities


Mentoring programs


Top-notch tech pack to enable you to do your most productive work


Brand new optimized-for-hybrid working HQ in Zurich as well as local offices in hotspots London, Tampere, Warsaw, Singapore and Tokyo


As well as specific benefits related to the location you are joining





 




We are proud to be “GREAT PLACE TO WORK” accredited in Switzerland, the UK, the USA, Poland, France and Italy and “GREAT PLACE TO WORK FOR WELLBEING” in the UK 




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed. 




 




Imagine the What. Build the How.




“Everybody is welcome here” - Is a celebrated component of our DNA.




At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.




All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed.




We help you capture every opportunity. www.scandit.com







#dataanalyst

Title: Junior Analyst (Data)
Description:
About the Department




Banking Supervision carries out on-site and ongoing supervision of licensed banks. The Banking Supervision team comprises professionals with a financial services academic background, but also legal and IT professionals to support policy and supervisory work.




About the Role




As Junior Analyst you will be responsible for the following main duties:
Monitoring, quantitative and qualitative analysis of information submitted and published by credit institutions;
Draw up reporting performance assessments for credit institutions, including challenging the quality of data as submitted/published by institutions;
Utilize available data extraction and visualisation tools to interpret data and present findings
Liaison with relevant stakeholders including credit institutions, the ECB, the EBA and others in connection with ongoing and/or ad-hoc tasks;
Proactive participation in exercises and projects undertaken by the Data Team (planned and ad-hoc), including both in-house projects and those with European Supervisory Authorities (EBA, ECB, other);
Support participation in local/EBA/ECB working groups, as well as other European regulatory bodies as may be required;
Assist in the development and implementation of new data collection initiatives and analytical frameworks.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness
General office management and administrative duties including stationery orders, invoicing, coordinating attendance reports, archiving and other admin-related tasks as necessary;
Direct support to the Head of function, including scheduling and coordination within Banking Supervision and other MFSA functions.
You will also be expected to undertake any other duties that may arise depending on the exigencies of Banking Supervision and the Authority.




About You




We are looking for candidates with background in Banking, Finance, Accountancy, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or in a related subject.

The role calls for an academic qualification in a relevant field of study at National Qualification Framework Level 6 or better, duly certified by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC) or a widely recognised professional qualification at a comparable level.

Having experience working in the area of financial services, especially within compliance and/or data, will be considered an asset. Candidates with longer working experience relevant to the role, or with proven knowledge of Excel and Business Intelligence Tools (such as PowerBI) will be preferred.




If you do not have the necessary academic or professional qualifications but you have at least five (5) years of relevant experience within the financial services environment, we would still be interested in speaking with you.




Other Information




The MFSA is an Equal Opportunities Employer as certified by the NCPE (National Commission for the Protection of Equality) and is committed to a policy of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment and will take care to avoid any form of discrimination in its recruitment procedures. The MFSA reserves the right to withdraw this call at any time and not to select any of the Candidates.

It is the responsibility of applicants in possession of qualifications awarded by Universities and other similar institutions outside Malta to produce a recognition statement on comparability of qualifications issued by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC). Applicants should do so preferably at application stage or otherwise at the preliminary interview should an applicant be selected for such interview. Details can be obtained by accessing the National Commission for Further and Higher Education website on www.ncfhe.gov.mt under MQRIC heading.

The MFSA shall ensure that any processing of personal data is in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation), the Data Protection Act (Chapter 586 of the Laws of Malta) and any other relevant European Union and national law. For further details, you may refer to the Data Protection Policy on the MFSA webpage www.mfsa.mt.

Candidates are to note that the submission of any false statement/s or omission, even if unintended, may lead to the cancellation of their application and may render the candidate's appointment liable to termination.

Furthermore, please note that candidates may be asked to submit any documentation in support of the information provided, including but not limited to, proof of qualifications and Police Conduct Certificates.




Public call number: 881/2023

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Come on board with Neo Group! Here's your chance to stir things up in the iGaming scene with us. We're not just expanding; we're revolutionizing the entire game, mastering profitability with every new venture. But you know what truly fuels our drive? It's people like you. Join us as we embark on a journey to redefine gaming on a global scale.

We are currently seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team at Neo Group. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to provide valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities:


Ensure the accuracy and alignment of comprehensive budget models with organizational goals and segments
Create detailed forecasts for costs, revenues, and other key metrics by utilizing historical data and market trends
Provide insights into profitability, growth opportunities, and cost efficiencies by analyzing data to identify key segments within the business
Analyze outcomes against established metrics and benchmarks to evaluate the effectiveness of different strategies and initiatives
Regularly update stakeholders on the progress and outcomes of cost reduction and growth efforts by monitoring and tracking them
Support the achievement of company goals by closely collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Acquisition, CRM, and Business Development



Requirements


Proven ability to analyze and solve complex problems with precision
Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL, Python/KNIME, and analytical libraries (Pandas, NumPy, etc.)
Demonstrated mastery of Excel and its data manipulation functions
Ability to handle and analyze large datasets, and conduct statistical analysis effectively
Deep understanding of data management principles and best practices for data governance
Keen attention to detail and adeptness in working with intricate data structures
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to effectively convey complex concepts
Experience in the iGaming industry will be considered a valuable advantage.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.



Benefits

🚀 Join us on an exciting journey to shape and revolutionize a new brand in the market

💼 Get ready to enjoy a comprehensive compensation and benefits package designed to enrich your work-life balance and well-being. This package includes a competitive salary, health insurance coverage, access to our on-site gym for a healthy lifestyle, complimentary breakfast and lunch to fuel your day, and a range of diverse social events to foster team spirit, belonging and collaboration

🌍 Experience an international work environment with a passionate, motivated and professional team

🏢 Be a part of our modern office space in Ta'Xbiex, conveniently located close to all amenities and one of Malta's sought-after marinas

Being part of Neo Group means more than just a job. It's about being a part of a vibrant community with over 40 nationalities across 8 global locations. As we embrace a thrilling phase of hyper-growth and scale-up, our success is fueled by the diversity and talent of our team—potentially including you!

Explore Neo Group Further:

For more details about life and careers at Neo Group, visit our Career Website connect with us on Instagram, and engage with us on LinkedIn.

Ready to redefine the future of iGaming with us? Apply today and become a part of something truly spectacular!
